188416.name: Planet Express: Futurama RPG
188416.description:
User summary:

Planet Express, subtitled "Futurama RPG", adapts the Fox cartoon series Futurama to the rules of Catalyst Game Lab's Cosmic Patrol system. The product contains the setting with associated variant rules (the document contains a full rule set - the Cosmic Patrol product is not needed for play). The document design is mirrored after the Cosmic Patrol rulebook and is divided into three major sections: Setting, Rules, and Characters (adapted form the cartoon series). Production values are unusually robust for this type of game product.

188418.name: Lejías del Espacio: Misión Don Benito de Indias
188418.description:
Entradilla editorial:

Una desquiciada aventura en un mundo propio del autor, en donde un nuevo Imperio Español se extiende por toda la galaxia, sin que esta tenga la culpa de nada. Además del trasfondo, en esta aventura los jugadores vivirán un enfrentamiento épico, cuando un grupo de “Caballeros Lejionarios del Espacio” es enviado a un planeta repleto de zombis.




From Publisher blurb:

A demented adventure in its own world, where a new Spanish Empire extends over the galaxy, even the galaxy has no blame for that. It includes the setting and an adventure displaying the epic showdown between a group of "Lejías Knights from the Space" and a planet full of zombies.

188419.name: El Lobo
188419.description:
Entradilla editorial

En la apartada comarca de Los Oscos, un lobo ha irrumpido en una casa y ha devorado a una anciana. La historia se vuelve especialmente trágica cuando el cuerpo despedazado es descubierto por la pequeña nieta de la víctima.

En pleno verano y sin noticias, un suceso tan dramático es recibido casi con alborozo por los medios de comunicación más sensacionalistas que se han lanzado sobre la comarca como buitres sobre un cadáver todavía caliente. Tanta alarma social ha asustado a los grupos ecologistas que ven peligrar la recuperación de lobos en la Cornisa Cantábrica, así como la población en mayor peligro de los Pirineos.

Los pocos habitantes de Santa Eulalia de Oscos, sobrellevarán atónitos la invasión de “foriatos” de ambos pelajes. Pero ellos saben que hay algo más de fondo en todo esto. Algo mucho más oscuro


=

From Publisher blurb:

In the remote county of Los Oscos, a wolf sneaked in a house and devoured an elderly woman. The story becomes very truculent when is her niece who discovers the body.

It's summer and there is no fresh notices. A dramatic event such that is recived by the yellow-press with open arms, travelling to the zone to cover the notice. Social alarm causes a group of ecologists arrive too, fearful for the recovery of wolf's population in the Cantabric Coast and the Pyrenees.

The people of Santa Eulalia de Oscos contemplate astonished the invasion of foreign people, but they know that there is happening something else in the area, something very dark...

188420.name: The Great Pendragon Campaign: 480-484 Expansion
188420.description:
From publisher blurb:

This never-before-seen, five-year expansion to the award-winning The Great Pendragon Campaign provides the option for starting a campaign in Year 480, the fateful year that Uther inherits the crown and forges the kingdom that will one day be the birthright of his son, King Arthur. Information for years 480-484 are presented in the same format as The Great Pendragon Campaign itself. The new book also includes a “Changes to the 1st Edition” introduction so that the expansion neatly fits into the GPC.

Please note that this GPC expansion is included in Book of Uther, so there is no need to purchase The Great Pendragon Campaign: King Uther Expansion if you already have Book of Uther.

188421.name: A Chronology for the Uther Period
188421.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free product provides a sneak peek of Book of Uther, a supplement for King Arthur Pendragon that provides more details on the workings of the Royal Court during the tumultuous life and times of King Uther Pendragon. The Chronology provides a year-by-year summary for the years 480-495, which you’ll note pushes the start date of The Great Pendragon Campaign five years earlier than than the prior 485.

We hope you enjoy this sample of Book of Uther and return to explore the entire supplement or even The Great Pendragon Campaign: King Uther Expansion that gives the option for starting a campaign in Year 480, the fateful year that Uther inherits the crown and forges the kingdom that will one day be the birthright of his son, King Arthur.

188422.name: Loot Hunter
188422.description:
User Summary

A pirate game with several different aspects. Exploration, ship upgrades, rising in the ranks of piracy, and loot collection is in the style of an RPG. Battles with other ships take place with a "Match 3" style puzzle mini-game.

188423.name: Pizza Express
188423.description:
Pizza Express is a fast-paced restaurant simulation for Windows, developed by one-man studio Onni Interactive, where you'll join the laborious Gastone and his wreckless friend Lucky in a tasty adventure which will bring you from zero to hero.

Manage every aspect of your pizzeria and make it become the best eatery in town. But be quick! You only have 30 days to conquer F.L.A.B. (Finger Licking Associated Bistros) hearts and top their table!

Source: The Game Website.

188424.name: Umi-Para-Dice

28827.name: 植民地戦争+α (Shokuminchi Sensou Plus Alpha)

188424.description:
User summary
海パラダイス (Umi-Para-Dice) means Sea Paradise in English.

Umi-Para-Dice is a dice game where players collect cute sea creatures (actually pencil erasers!) and make their own aquarium.

One player rolls a number of dice equal to twice the number of players, and players take turns taking one die. Each player collects a sea creature that corresponds to the two numbers of their dice taken, and place that creature onto their personal board.

The game ends when dice are rolled 12 times. Each player scores according to the types of creatures collected. Bonus scores are added by multiple creatures of a kind and positions on the personal board. The player with the highest total wins the game.

The game is for 1-2 players with one copy. Up to four players can play if two copies are combined.

Publisher's summary
サイコロを振って海の生き物を集めていく、箱庭的 水族館ボードゲーム。海の生き物は可愛い消しゴムで出来ています。サイコロを手番の人が人数×2個振って、手番の人から時計回りに、2週1つづつとります。取った2つのサイコロの目に該当する海の生き物を手に入れます。同じ海の生き物を集めたりすると、ボーナスが貰え、最後にサイコロを振って加点出来ます。
1セット1・2人用ですが、2セットで3・4人で遊べ、みんなでワイワイと遊ぶことが出来ます。

188425.name: Monstrous Miscellany #01: Abnokh, Greethaw, Notoros & Styram
188425.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Miscellany #01 contains four monsters for use with Labyrinth Lord:

Abnokh, 3 HD Chaotic Evil Demon-Kin that trouble the Material Plane, seeking out victims for their terrible rites and rituals...
Greethaw, 13 HD Chaotic Evil giants steeped in demonolatry and sorcery, seeking that which has been lost and forgotten... and slaughtering all who get in their way...
Notoros, 1 HD Chaotic Evil goat-headed fey who use the bones of their victims to frighten foes, can transform their prey into goats, and seek to enslave elves, pixies, and sprites for vile purposes...
Styram, 5 HD Lawful Good angels of retribution, summoned to the Material Plane to avenge the desecration of Lawful holy sites...




Each creature is fully described and detailed for use with Labyrinth Lord, easily converted to any other old-school RPG system.

188426.name: Camden
188426.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Black Lantern Society is at it again!

This time they're reporting on the city of Camden, known to most of Shaintar as the Snakes Den. This report will give both GM's and players a solid background for creating characters and NPC's from these vicious streets filled with greed and politics.

You'll learn about several groups that live and work within the streets and we've also provided you with several new edges and other rules stuff to get started. The intrigue can get deadly and its worth your life to gain the attention of the wrong people. The Black Lanterns hope to find information to help them gain the trust of Camden in order for it to sign the Grey Ranger's charter. They've not succeeded...yet!

188427.name: Ju:block

28827.name: 植民地戦争+α (Shokuminchi Sensou Plus Alpha)

188427.description:
User summary
樹ブロック (Ju:block) is a collection of blocks, made of three different woods (Japanese cypress, Japanese big-leaf magnolia, and Japanese red oak).

Different woods have different density, so even blocks of the same shape have different weight.

Using these blocks with various shape and material, you can play three different games (competitive balance, co-operative balance, and chess-like strategy game).

This game has several expansions. With these expansions, you can play other types of games, such as territory-occupation game and maze game. You can also play more technical balance games.

Publisher's summary
ヒノキ、ホオノキ、赤樫の3つの重さの違う木材で作られたいろいろな形のブロックを使って、バランスゲームや、チェスのような思考型ゲームなど3つの遊び方が楽しめます。
別売の追加セットを購入することで、陣取りゲームやさらにアグレッシブなバランスゲームを楽しむことが出来ます。

188428.name: Kusukuma
188428.description:
The publisher of KUSUKUMA is Lycée Classique Echternach. Kusukuma is the result of a student game development class (main game idea by Charel Bintz) under the guidance of Dennis Kirps (teacher) and the help of Christian Kruchten (prototype development). The class itself was originated by professor Carmen Schares.

The objective of the game is to push the opponent off the board by cleverly pushing the Kusukuma discs, so that the final player keeps at least one Kusukuma disc of his own on the board. However, as the die determines the colour of the next move, a player might have to push his own disc(s) off the board. The question arises: “Who will be left?”

PLAY
The active player throws the die and chooses exactly one of the following three moves:

1. If one of the four colours is cast, the player has to move one of the discs corresponding to the cast colour by exactly one square horizontally or vertically (not diagonally), even if said colour does not correspond to his own!
2. If the joker is cast, the player can push any disc, his own, his opponent’s or even the joker.
3. If the blank side is cast, the player cannot make a move, and it is the next player’s turn.

END OF GAME AND WINNER
The game is over when:

there is only one disc or discs of the same colour left on the game-board. The player representing this colour wins.
there is only the joker left on the game-board. In this case everybody wins.
in a game of two or three players, there are only neutral discs left on the game-board. In this case there is no winner.

188429.name: Artefakt Sonderband 1: Psychedelic Interzone
188429.description:
This special issue of the fanzine "Artefakt" contains a Call of Cthulhu campaing set in the late 1960s.

The characters start their investigation in Wales and later pass into a parallel world called "Psychedelic Interzone" which seems like a twisted dream of a drug poisened mind.

The campaign had been published on DVD (PDF) and came with a collection with all out-of-print issues of the fanzine (#8 - #15).

It also came with it's own character sheet.

188430.name: Puzzlo
188430.description:
The Speed-puzzle game.

One who puts the most pieces in to the game, wins.
Players build the same puzzle with their own pieces.

Vauhdikas palapelikilpa!

Ett fartfyllt pusselrace!

188431.name: Artefakt (Issue 6 - 1997)
188431.description:
Containing adventures of the following RPG-systems:

- Call of Cthulhu (Nur für eine Nacht)
- Earthdawn (Das Geheimnis der Orichalkummünze)
- Star Wars (Nharwak's Point)

Furthermore an article about writing adventures and an intruduction to the SciFi RPG "Sunrise 2700" can be found.

188433.name: Leppisleikki
188433.description: Leppisleikki ("Ladybird") is a fun and active game for the entire family that develops motor skills as well as balance and control. In the Ladybird game, players carry out various active tasks together with ladybird. Players are rewarded for successful tasks with the ladybird advancing upwards towards the flower on the stem and winning.

188434.name: Ysgarth Ethnology Sourcebook
188434.description:
User summary:

This supplement for the Ysgarth 6th Edition provides setting information and resources for playing the game on the eponymous world. It is the most difficult to find supplement of the 6th Edition game.

188435.name: Artefakt (Issue 17 - 2006)
188435.description:
This issue contains two adventures for the RPG system Call of Cthulhu (Die Erben vom Malmsley House; Yellow Submarine) and a background for Call of Cthulhu (Frieden auf Erden) which gives more detailed information for the second adventure but can also stand for itself.

This issue closes with the description of a town valled "Homana" for the system Arcane Codex and a review of the German convention Spiel'05 in Essen.

188436.name: War of Ashes: Fate of Agaptus
188436.description:
Publisher blurb:

Brush your fur and sharpen your eye teeth. War is coming.

Welcome to the War of Ashes RPG: Fate of Agaptus! This "grimsical" minis-friendly tabletop RPG is based on the popular miniature game. Head off to adventure in a world where the inhabitants might look cute and cuddly but often carry pointy objects with which they might just decide to stab you. Play as a determined Elvorix, a vengeful Vidaar, a militaristic Jaarl, or a ravenous Kuld. Stage Romanic-style battles and then celebrate your victory with a pint of kogg.

Inside, you'll find everything you need to get started, including:


Fate-style lightweight approaches combined with detailed minis-compatible combat to get the best of both worlds.
Character generation instructions and even sample characters to get you started on a romp across Agapta.
A bestiary full of interesting creatures that you can tame, hunt, or light on fire.
Plenty of settings and stories to fuel your campaigns.

188437.name: Alien Worlds
188437.description:
Alien Worlds offers a set of simple, fast-paced rules that even young children (5+) will understand and enjoy.

Alien Worlds is an introductory wargame that pits two teams of six characters against each other across the tabletop. Players can customise their teams to find the right balance of abilities to match their playing style.

The rules include three ways to play - a straightforward skirmish, a retrieval mission and a "High Ground" scenario, adding extra replay value. The winner is the first to meet his objective, or the last with characters still standing.

A handful of miniatures, a couple of six-sided dice and a bit of imagination are all that's required to enjoy Alien Worlds.

188439.name: Ysgarth Bestiary
188439.description:
From the introduction:

A Guide to creatures from the world of Ysgarth. [Includes] four dozen creatures, described and illustrated, plus a complete short adventure and more.

188440.name: Firepower: A Gamer's Guide to Modern Firearms
188440.description:
User summary:

Firepower is a concise resource supplement adding data and generic rules for handling firearms and automatic weapons in modern games. Written in a generic, universal approach the product was nevertheless marketed as a supplement for To Challenge Tomorrow, but also included conversion information for GDW's Twilight 2000, Hero Games' Hero System and Steve Jackson Games' GURPS.

188441.name: Kiss My Ass 2nd edition
188441.description:
It is 1944, eastern front was falling into its ,ost dangerous phase. With overwhelming military power soviet forces have penetrated german front lines in various places succeeded in surroundING a German Corp . The Germans have assembled a handful of armored units to rescue the besieged german troops.

Kiss my ass is a card game on tactical combat in the eastern front 1944. One player plays the Germans and the other the ussr.

The game has 110 cards, 6 dice an English and japanese language rules manuals..The game is based on motofumi kobayashi's classic manga Black Knight

188442.name: A Complete Gamer's Pantheon (1986 Edition)
188442.description:
From the introduction:

An accurate and detailed guide to mythology and pantheistic religion for role-players and game designers.

Includes Norse Aesir, Nosre Vanir, Norse Jottun, Imperial Rome, Roman Gaul, Cymric & British, Celtic Fomori, and an Archetypal Pantheon.

188443.name: A Complete Gamer's Pantheon (1991 Edition)
188443.description:
User summary:

Presents extensive information regarding deities, pantheons, and religions in a system neutral format.

Includes the materials form the 1986 version (Norse Aesir, Norse Vanir, Norse Jottun, Imperial Rome, Roman Gaul, Cymric & British, Celtic Fomori) as well as numerous additions.

188444.name: Siege and Fortress
188444.description:
From the introduction:

A complete guide to the construction, siege and defense of the medieval castle.

User summary:

Presents system agnostic details about the design, construction, and use of medieval fortifications. Directed at game designers and role-players.

188446.name: Baroque Space Opera
188446.description:
From the Introduction:

Baroque Space Opera is a setting for Fate Core that takes place in a fantastic yet familiar universe filled with mysteries, wonders, and dangers. Baroque is designed to facilitate fast-paced, pulpy adventures in a futuristic setting with improbable science and technologies. While the primary feel is space opera, Baroque blends elements from steampunk and cyberpunk to horror and fantasy. Baroque takes its inspiration from multiple sources, everything from Lexx to Frank Herbert's DUNE to Metabarons to Farscape and the Ancient Astronaut Hypothesis. You can find a more complete list of inspirational sources at the end of this book.

188447.description:
The Frost Dragon is an expansion for both Arcadia Quest, and Arcadia Quest inferno.

The game comes with a large Dragon Mini, new loot cards, new tiles and the new type of cards, "Dragonstone cards".

After finishing a campaign, the players will get a new load out of Level 6 Upgrade cards, with a budget that is based on the amount of medals each guild completed during the campaign.

This last part of the fight doesn’t have PvP Quest Cards and all players have to kill the Dragon before he wrecks too much of the city! This is a fully cooperative fight, in which the players win as a group if they manage to kill the Dragon and they lose if too many parts of the city have been destroyed, or if the Dragon kills Heroes so much that they can’t find the resolve to continue the fight. In this ultimate showdown, the Dragon is controlled by a special set of Dragon Turn cards that will trigger special attacks and movements from the Frost Dragon. Players will need to make tough choices in the face of the Dragon's actions, deciding as a group where to focus their efforts (and who to sacrifice).

Contents:

1 Dragon figure
1 double-sided Tile
24 Level 6 Upgrade cards
2 Relic cards
14 Dragonstone cards
24 Dragon Turn cards
20 Frost tokens
2 Dragon Monster cards (tarot-sized!)
1 Rulebook/Campaign book
1 Dragon power card
188447.name: Arcadia Quest: Frost Dragon

188448.description: Hïlda is a playable hero with a miniature and card for Arcadia Quest and Arcadia Quest Inferno. She is a kick-starter exclusive character gotten by having backed Arcadia Quest: Inferno, and additionally having made the optional purchase for the Arcadia Quest: Frost Dragon expansion.
188448.name: Arcadia Quest: Hïlda

188449.name: Arduin Weapons Cards
188449.description:
From the introduction:

Compatible with fantasy role-playing games. Contains 24 magik weapons cards. The 'stats' side of these cards should be filled in with information consistent with the game nature of the item and with its context within the game world. How much of this information the referee imparts to the player prior to his taking possession is variable with the player's abilities and actions. Usually, he won't find out all of its characteristics until later.

User summary:

Three cardstock sheets intended to be cut into "cards". Each card has an image on one side and data on the other. For use as a play aid.

188455.description:
The Battle of Belleau Wood is one of the most famous engagements in the long and storied history of the United States Marine Corps. Weeks of brutal combat earned them the grudging respect of the vanquished Germans, who called them Teufelhunde - Devil Dogs.

IN THE TRENCHES (ITT) system makes its Tiny Battle debut with three scenarios drawn from this exciting battle. Designed by John Gorkowski, this series enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. ITT challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulsed-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspire historically accurate play without forcing decisions.

This set includes all the counters you’ll need to play these scenarios, PLUS all the status markers and administrative counters you’ll need to play any expansion.

Includes:

176 counters to manouevre
Three 8.5x11-inch maps
1 rulebook to rifle through
1 Player Aid Card and Scenario Card
1 Game Turn Track




(source: Tiny Battle Publishing website)
188455.name: In the Trenches: Devil Dogs

188456.description:
Sector Prime is a fast paced, light 4X board game using a balanced dice rolling mechanic that avoids a runaway winner and also keeps the game exciting and balanced right to the end. The unique design of the tiles provides a completely new game board each time, requiring players to adapt the strategies each time they play!

Each player represents a mining faction seeking to control the mining rights to the sector. You need to control enough planetary systems to mine the needed materials to complete the construction of your Mining Station
In each turn there are 3 phases:

(1) Explore.
By a roll of the dice move your mining drones to new planet tiles.

(2) Expand or Exterminate.
You must choose to either invade and attack another mining faction OR to build defenses, new routes of exploration or a section of your Station thus bringing you one step closer to victory.

(3) Exploit.
In this phase you gather the results of your mining operations. You can simply gather the minimum OR you can gamble by pushing your drones produce double. Be careful, because this isn't always successful.

The first player to complete construction of their Station wins the game!
188456.name: Sector Prime

188457.name: To Challenge Tomorrow Basic Rules (4th Edition)
188457.description:
User summary:

To Challenge Tomorrow - Basic Rules, is essentially a "quick start" set of rules for the 4th Edition of the game, presented without optional rules. It contains approximately one third of the material of the "complete basic rules" product released the following year.

188458.name: To Challenge Tomorrow (1st Edition)
188458.description:
To Challenge Tomorrow: Role Playing Past, Present, and Future Science-Fiction and Historical Rules

User summary:

To Challenge Tomorrow 1st Edition presented a surprisingly complete and modern role-playing game with a focus on detail and realism. The system inherited many aspects of the Ysgarth fantasy system, including a classless Skill system.

188459.name: Worlds of Adventure
188459.description:
User summary:

Worlds of Adventure was an early supplement for To Challenge Tomorrow and presented generic "science fiction" setting material for the game master. Although it was published during the 1st Edition period of the game it remained a useful resource throughout the next several editions.

188460.name: Adventures Historical/Speculative
188460.description:
To Challenge Tomorrow
Adventures Historical/Speculative
Four Scenarios

User summary:

Adventures Historical/Speculative was an early supplement for To Challenge Tomorrow and presented four scenarios for the science fiction setting. The scenarios ranged from "hard" science fiction to space opera in tone. Although it was published during the 1st Edition period of the game it remained a useful resource throughout the next several editions.

188462.name: Monster Mash
188462.description:
From the introduction:

Here it is: Super Console’s first supplement. Within you’ll find everything you need to take up arms on behalf of the Main Villain, to play a monster turned to the cause of good, or to become a dark overlord yourself.

188463.name: Star Empire
188463.description:
From the book:

You’re playing a teenager in an interstellar war. Let’s face it: this is not a highly believable scenario on any level. A key to enjoying space opera is to avoid considering what’s happening too closely. Start asking “why” and the GM will have to start making up stuff about midiclorians, and no one wants that. You’re a huge hero in a galaxy-wide revolution. Sit back and enjoy it.

...

Can your characters ever go back to high school, knowing that they’ve saved the universe and now they’re sitting through a Geometry class?

rpgseries.39122: HIG - Living Greyhawk Highfolk Regional Adventures

188464.name: A Gnome's Affair
188464.description:
From the introduction:

A one-round D&D Living Greyhawk Highfolk Regional Adventure

As an aspiring hero of Highfolk and the Flanaess, you are asked to come to a feast of small proportions to celebrate your deeds. A home-cooked meal, a warm cozy fire, a hearty tale from an old gnome, a journey deep into the Vesve again, where no one can hear you scream...

Recommended for Rangers of the Vesve, nature-based, and/or demihuman PCs. For characters levels 1-6.

User summary:

This tournament module was expected to be completed in one four-hour play block, including one hour for setup and three hours for completion. The module is scored.

boardgamehonor.37705: 2016 Årets Spel Best Family Game Nominee

188465.name: Otrio
188465.description: Played on a wooden board, there are three ways to win this abstract-strategy game: Get three circular pieces of your color in a row in either ascending or descending order; get the same sized pieces in a row; or get three concentric pieces in the same space.

188466.name: Exposing Kyuss:  The Hunt is On
188466.description:
From the introduction:

A one-round D&D Living Greyhawk County of Urnst Regional Adventure

The streets of Radigast City are teeming with the bustle of everyday life. The common folk are oblivious to the growing danger of the evil undead cult that has targeted the rich farmlands of the County of Urnst. You realize to keep the realm safe, you must find those responsible for bringing the unholy religion of Kyuss to your homeland. An adventure for character levels 1-6.

User summary:

This tournament module was expected to be completed in one four-hour play block, including one hour for setup and three hours for completion. The module is scored.

188467.name: Festival Knight
188467.description:
From the introduction:

A one-round D&D 3rd Edition Living Greyhawk Adventure

It's the Festival of the Fallen Knights! There'll be games, food, drink, and a morbid parade as the Flanaess remembers those who died to save it. Keep an eye out, though... you never know which monsters are simply wearing masks, and which are all to real. This is an adaptable scenario for Tiers 1-3.

User summary:

This tournament module was expected to be completed in one four-hour play block, including one hour for setup and three hours for completion. The module is scored.

Two separate, brief DOC supplements were provided to adapt this module to Sunndi and Perrenland regional play.

188468.name: Name Game Jr.

boardgameimplementation.24234: Name Game: The Celebrity Guessing Game

188468.description:
From the creator of the original "Name Game" comes this new edition that will leave the family guessing!

Designed for younger and older players. Draw a card and give creative descriptions and clues... Try to get your team to guess as many names as possible before the timer runs out.

188471.name: The Golden Scroll of Justice
188471.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Golden Scroll of Justice lets you bring your old-school RPG into a whole new world of wuxia/kung fu action based on Chinese mythology, history, and folklore. The book contains:

Two new PC races: the shanxiao (monkey-man) and gouren (dog-man)
Two new character classes: the wu and the fangshi, along with guidelines on how to use your existing classes in a mythic China setting
Hundreds of new spells
Rules for kung fu that fit seemlessly into the existing combat and skill system, but still allows for cool "cinematic" moves
New weapons and armor
New magic items
New monsters
And much more!




The rules are designed to be completely modular; take what you like, leave what you don't. Want fangshi and gouren but not the kung fu system? No problem. Everything will still work fine.

188472.description:
This Portugal map has been designed for 3-5 players (though also possibly playable with 2) and features Portugal during the height of its industrial development (1855-65). This map adds quite a few nuances to the base game such as:

a.) Banks were hesitant to invest in the industrial sector so loans return $1 less for each additional loan after the first.

b.) Railway expansion was highly encouraged - certain rails are worth $4 at the end of the game instead of $2 and there are bonus VP for the player who finishes with the most VP.

c.) Government debt was mounting rapidly due to poor management so to simulate this waste, corruption, and poor economy, there is always a region or industry where you CANNOT build.

...and many more!

Players must navigate the map's tightness - don't forget the option to combine both actions to build anywhere! - and suffocating economy to try and build a prosperous network.
188472.name: Portugal (fan expansion to Age of Industry)

188473.name: And a Bottle of Rum
188473.description:
Battle on the high seas or in the crowded streets of the Spanish Main as a Pirate, Pirate Hunter or a simple Merchant in this minatures game!

Using the Chain Reaction System found in all of Two Hour Wargames, you field a group of characters with very simple stats: Reputation and Weapons. Activation rolls tell you when you are able to go (higher rolls go first, but only activate higher Reputation groups) and then you may move and fire/charge. That's it!

Of course, being the reaction system, the other figures on the board won't be sitting and waiting for you to finish in a IGO-UGO fashion, but will react to your moves using a series of tables that may have them running from you, drawing pistols and firing, or charging into combat swords shining!

Be the last pirate standing and win!
Or play a campaign and retire with the most gold to win!

Rules to adventure ashore?Check!
Big Land Battles to sack Panama? Check!
Ship combat with boarding actions? Check!
Big Sea Battles to fight fleets? Check!
Treasure maps and buried treasure? Check!

188474.name: The Partisan Passenger Version
188474.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 inch by 30 inch, floor plan of a Passenger Spaceship, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The Zip File includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“Here is the drop point. Remember that the pirates hit us and we were forced to split from the passenger side to escape.”—Captain of The Partisan.

The Partisan (Passenger Version) is a single floor interior map of a spaceship that can split in half to function as two separate vessels with a northern crew side and a southern passenger side.

The Partisan (Passenger Version) is intended for use in near or far-future science fiction settings.

Tithe of the Tenth Cargo: The Partisan makes frequent dangerous journeys through a quadrant riddled with pirates. They have a tremendous success rate, bordering on 84% including their initial failure rate in their first year.

After the first year, The Partisan made a deal with pirates in the quadrant, The Red Drudge, known for scavenging the scrap of starships stained with blood when their targets failed to surrender. The Partisan would get protection to and from destinations in the quadrant, but every tenth passenger cargo would be given to the pirates without a fight.

Law enforcement is spread thin throughout the quadrant. However, information from an escaped slave that survived the last tithe has surfaced. The testimony points to The Partisan being in league with the pirates in some way. The group is sent to tail The Partisan and check to see if the story of the witness is true either as a mercenary contract mission or as part of the organization patrolling that lawless frontier of space called The Constabulary.

When the group witnesses the drop, they have to decide how to react with pirate ships moving to grab the passenger side of The Partisan and the crew side of The Partisan slipping away from the drop point. Which side of The Partisan does the group go after?

188475.name: Mudslide (M&M3)
188475.description:
From publisher blurb:

Limping his way through life, Lester Mullins was on a long road to nowhere. It was this road that led to an accident, sparking his mutant ability. Now a massive nuisance to the public and Law Enforcement alike, Lester has massive ability and a monstrous appearance as Mudslide!

188476.name: Urban Riot (Pathfinder)
188476.description:
From publisher blurb:

Riots provide almost limitless opportunities for adventure. However, few adventures feature riots because they are problematic to flesh out. Designing all the rioters and the many minor events the PCs witness would take more time to prepare than even the most diligent GM has at his disposal. That’s where Campaign Events: Urban Riot comes in. Presenting copious notes on the rioters themselves as well as minor events and dressing along with hooks, opportunities and complications it takes the hassle out of running an urban riot and lets the GM concentrate on the important details of the campaign!

Campaign Events provides you the busy GM with the tools to run exciting, flavoursome adventures or encounters set against the backdrop of a significant event. Perhaps the adventures find themselves in the midst of a riot or prison break. They might even be invited to a masquerade ball or be caught in the grip of a savage storm.

Campaign Events presents the details of such events so the busy GM can focus on building exciting, memorable adventures.

188477.name: Hard West
188477.description:
Hard West is CFGs newest project. It is a turn-based squad tactical with adventurous world exploration. Think X-Com combat with Heroes of Might and Magic world map.

Source: The Developer Website.

188478.name: The Struggle for Portugal: Peninsular War III, 1810-11
188478.description:
From the publisher:

The Struggle for Portugal - Peninsular War III contains four battles in Portugal and Spain during 1811: Barrosa, Fuentes de Oñoro, and Albuera.

The Struggle for Portugal - Peninsular War III is one of the games from OSG's The Library of Napoleonic Battles series. Details on the series are below, as all the games share a common rules set and game system.

BATTLES SIMULATED

Barrosa, 5 March 1811
A reduction in the besieging forces gave the garrison of Cadiz an opportunity to break out. Loading on to naval transports, they debarked at Tarifa and moved to engage the siege lines from the rear. The French, under the command of Marshal Victor, placed one division on the road to Cadiz, while his two remaining divisions fell on the single Anglo-Portuguese division under Sir Thomas Graham. Following a fierce battle, the British succeeded in routing the French but could not prevent their reoccupying their siege lines.

Fuentes de Onoro, 3 - 5 May 1811
Wellington first secured Portugal and then set about re-taking the fortified frontier cities of Almeida, Badajoz, and Ciudad Rodrigo. Whilst Wellington besieged Almeida, Massena reformed his battered army and marched to relieve the French garrison in the city. Wellington chose to check the relief attempt at the small village of Fuentes de Oñoro.

La Albuera 16 May 1811
Wellesley sent Sir William Beresford to retake the border town of Badajoz. Soult rapidly gathered a new army from Andalusia and, joining with the troops retreating before Beresford, he marched to relieve the siege. With the Spanish army under General Joaquin Blake approaching, he planned to turn Beresford's flank and interpose his army between his position and the Spaniards. However, the Spaniards had already linked up with the Anglo-Portuguese corps, and his 24,000 troops now faced a combined Allied army 35,000 strong. The opposing armies met at the village of Albuera. Both sides suffered heavily in the ensuing struggle and the French eventually withdrew on 18 May.

DESCRIPTION

The Library of Napoleonic Battles - formerly known as the Napoleon's Last Battles (NLB) Series:


480 meters per hex,
1 hour per turn,
400-800 men per strength point.


Each Approach to Battle game lasts about 22 turns. The Full campaign links the individual battles.

188481.name: Imperial Strike Force
188481.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the tradition of the Starjammers or the Shi'ar Imperial Guard, the Imperial Strike Force is a group of time-lost interstellar commandos trying to fight the good fight in a complicated cosmos.

These characters are ready to be enemies, allies or NPCs in your ICONS game

188482.name: Joe's Diner

rpgseries.29027: Case Files of the Blue Book Detective Agency

188482.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a thrilling 1st level adventure and reusable location for Gangbusters RPG.

Eat at Joe's Diner, one of lakefront cities great places to hang out and rub elbow with the locals and learn what the pulse of the city is really like.

This is the first in a series of modules after several decades for use with the GANGBUSTERS™ RPG rules. Joe’s Diner is specially designed for the game judge who needs to get back up to speed with the system.

Gangbusters is a game that takes place in the Roaring 20’s and early 1930’s, essentially the Prohibition Era, of America. The focus of the game is on the Prohibition and the police/law enforcement struggle to control the streets and the halls of power. The player characters can take the roles of law enforcement, criminals, and other types of roles. The game is based in Lakefront City, ostensibly a fictional Chicago.

188485.name: Fortress

rpgseries.38449: BDK - Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms Adventure

188485.description:
A two-round continuous D&D Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms regional adventure

From the introduction:

Second in the "Hiring Trouble" series, this 8-hour adventure pits the characters against an (almost) impenetrable fortress, with help from Gaiyle Markhalla. This "breaking & entering" mission almost certainly requires at least one rogue. An adventure for character levels 1-8.

User summary:

This tournament module was expected to be completed in two contiguous four-hour play blocks, including one hour for setup, one hour for scoring, and six hours for completion. The module is scored.

188487.name: A Snake in the Grass
188487.description:
A one-round D&D 3rd Edition Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

Bandit activity is on the rise, and a traitor may be hiding somewhere in the city. You are asked to find him discreetly before he can disappear again. An adaptable adventure for levels 1-6.

User summary:

This tournament module was expected to be completed in one four-hour play block, including one hour for setup, and three hours for completion. The module is scored.

Two separate, brief DOC supplements were provided to adapt this module to Sunndi and Perrenland regional play.

188488.name: Kuka on putkessa?
188488.description: This game brings a whole new experience! Players write down the names of people on the piece hidden in small hose pieces. These people will then be portrayed in three different ways. The game is played in three rounds where all teams meet each other. Fast glossary, loud laughter, tongue-tied, blackout and wild gestures succeed each other in a fast pace! A brand new party game that never gets old!

188489.name: The Package

rpgseries.38449: BDK - Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms Adventure

188489.description:
A one-round D&D Living Greyhawk Bandit Kingdoms regional scenario

From the introduction:

First in the "Hiring Trouble" series, the characters find themselves hired in Rookroost to intercept a package and deliver it to their new employer. Recommended for well-balanced parties with at least one rogue, capable of both urban and rural adventuring. For characters level 1-6.

User summary:

This tournament module was expected to be completed in one four-hour play block, including one hour for setup, and three hours for completion. The module is scored.

188490.name: Nomsters
188490.description:
Stop Nomsters from getting candies.

In the game you and your friend(s), stop the Nomsters from getting candies and other goods by throwing bean-bags at them.

188492.name: Pikku Kakkosen posti
188492.description:
You are a mail deliverer.

You goal is to deliver mails faster than other players.

188493.name: Sequence Cats
188493.description:
In this variant edition of Sequence, the poker decks have been replaced by two decks each depicting 42 different breeds of house cat, from the Abyssinian to the Turkish Van. The board has been reduced from 10x10 to 7x12, with no wild corners. The Jacks have been replaced by Purr and Meow cards.

As in traditional Sequence, the object of the game is for one player or team to form a line of five or more consecutive chips, either orthogonally or diagonally. Players take turns drawing and playing cards, using a card from hand to claim one space on the board matching the played card. 2 or 3 players can play; higher player counts are supported via team play.

188494.description:
This is a third-party expansion that brings the air combat action of Check Your 6! to the skies of Word War I. The book contains supplementary rules to convert the CY6! mechanics for play in the WWI era. Included are over 70 historical scenarios presented in the CY6! format. Stats and maneuver sheets for 78 British, French, and German aircraft are also provided.

Note: The original Check Your 6! rulebook is required to play.
188494.name: Colorful Skies: WWI Air War Scenarios

188495.name: Artefakt (Issue 19 - 2007)
188495.description:
This issue contains adventures of the following RPG systems:

- Call of Cthulhu (... vielleicht auch träumen)
- Turm der Seelen (Arcane Codex)

Furthermore the following articles:

- SciFi Kultfilme (1965-2000); science-fiction movies
- Horrorviecher, Teil 2: Vampire; vampires and their appearance in movies, games and everyday household tools
- Abenteuerliche Orte: Oneiros; generic city-background

188496.description:
From the publisher:

All people know that food is divided into four categories: chomp chomps, snick-snacks, crunchies, and yellow circles. In the US and the world, food is a big part of everyone’s daily lives. When people don’t have enough of it, it causes a big problem! Here’s an expansion about the topic: food.


24 white & 6 black cards about brekky gruffles and syrupy friend chortles.
Co-written with our friends at Lucky Peach magazine.
This is an expansion. Requires Cards Against Humanity.
Goodbye food, goodbye from mouth, you are on your journey now.
188496.name: Cards Against Humanity: Food Pack

188497.description:
From the publisher:

Oh no! Not another f***ing elf! It’s the Fantasy Pack, co-written by make-believers Pat Rothfuss, Neil Gaiman, Sam Sykes, Myke Cole, Jacqueline Carey, Martha Wells, Sherwood Smith, Elizabeth Bear, and Wesley Chu. Look at how famous these people are! You basically have to buy this pack now that you’ve read this list.


23 white & 7 black cards that will hopefully be turned into a $300 million film franchise.
This is an expansion. Requires Cards Against Humanity.
All profits go to Pat Rothfuss’ Worldbuilders charity.
188497.name: Cards Against Humanity: Fantasy Pack

188498.description:
From publisher's website:

Except for the rampant misinformation and unspeakable pornography, the Internet is one of Al Gore's greatest inventions. We are writing this pack right now in a Reddit AMA with the help of a bunch of Internet strangers, which historically has always been a complete disaster.


25 white & 5 black cards written with anonymous users of the web page Reddit.
This is an expansion. Requires Cards Against Humanity.
All profits go to the Electronic Frontier Foundation.
188498.name: Cards Against Humanity: World Wide Web Pack

188499.name: Artefakt Sonderband 2: Weird Wars LARP
188499.description:
This special issue contains two LARP adventures for the system Weird Wars.

- "Total Germany" is set in 1939 right at the start of World War II on a Polish cruiser on its way to Mexico. One of its guests is carrying the famous Enigma and lots of agents are trying to steal it. There are characters and storylines for up to 21 players including maps and handouts.

- "Once upon a time in Mexico" is a follow-up LARP adventure for the same system. Leo Trotzki is hiding in a small town and there are plenty of people who want to find him for several reasons. This part can be played with up to 35 players.

This issue also comes with some quickstart rules to help game masters to cope with so many different plots and players and was published on CD (PDF).

188500.description: Keep your Rage, Axes and Glory tokens where they are supposed to be with our Blood Rage Overlay. Made from 3mm Clear Acrylic, the overlay covers the entire player mat with a slight overhang on the top. The Overlay has slots for the Rage track, and rage/axes/glory levels. There are also cut outs to hold upgrade cards at a slight angle for easy placement and removal of both sleeved and un-sleeved cards.
188500.name: Blood Rage: Acrylic Playermat Overlay

188001.name: FirstFable Swashbuckler Character Book
188001.description:
From publisher blurb:

The FirstFable: Swashbuckler Character Book is a supplement created to allow you to play a Swashbuckler in FirstFable by OneBookShelf, Inc.

188002.name: Find the Lady
188002.description:
From the Introduction:

Find the Lady is an adventure for the D&D and AD&D game systems. It is designed for a party of 1st-3rd level characters, with secondary skills generated according to the article in this issue. This scenario was not designed with any set number of characters or mix of professions and levels in mind, and could equally well be run as a group or solo adventure. It can be played as a one-off adventure or as part of the Pelinore or Zhalindor campaigns, and notes are included on placing the adventure in either world.

188003.name: Hauska Kiusa
188003.description:
Hauska Kiusa ("Funny Bully" in english) is an childrens card game from early 1980s. The idea is to divide the cards evenly between two, three or four players leaving the "Kiusa"-card at the center of the table.
The players, in turns, play the cards by rules. The first player without any cards in hand wins. Who has "Kiusa"-card in hand loses (he/she gets minus twenty five points), other players get one minus point for every card they have in hand.

188004.name: The Taking of Siandabhair
188004.description:
From the Introduction:

This mini-module has been designed for a group of 4-7 characters of 4th to 6th levels of experience. It requires information only found in the AD&D game rules, and cannot be played without them.

The inspiration for this scenario comes from the legends of the Celtic people. However, it is not intended to be a reconstruction of any particular story from that mythos, nor is it intended to be an adventure set in any historical context. The scenario has been designed to allow the DM to introduce a Celtic feel into play. Therefore it is possible for players to use characters who have not existed in this kind of background before, but who have taken up residence in the lands of Conall mac Éogan.

188005.name: Sethotep
188005.description:
From the Introduction:

This adventure has been designed for use with the D&D, AD&D and DRAGONQUEST roleplaying game systems. It is intended for characters with some experience but who are not too powerful - in D&D and AD&D game terms, characters of 2nd-4th levels.

The inspiration for this scenario comes from the history and mythology of Ancient Egypt. However, it is not intended to be a reconstruction of any historical or mythological event, nor to be set in any historical context. The aim has been to create a role-playing adventure with an Egyptian atmosphere. It is therefore possible to use characters who have not existed in this kind of milieu before, but who have moved into an area of a fantasy world comparable to Ancient Egypt.

188006.description: This is a limited edition variant model for "Mad Ivan" Where he is sculpted with a jack-o-lantern on his head. 200 of the miniatures were created, and were available through the Cool Mini Or Not website.
188006.name: Rum & Bones: Halloween Mad Ivan

188008.description: 猟奇耽異-キュリオシティ・ハンティング (Curiosity Hunting) is an expansion for Phantom Detectives that provides personalities for each of the twelve suspect cards, with those personalities translating in game terms to special abilities.
188008.name: 猟奇耽異-キュリオシティ・ハンティング (Curiosity Hunting)

188009.description:
Stunde Null is the German language equivalent of "zero hour", a term taken from military planning that indicates the beginning of some operation or event. In Germany, Stunde Null has a particular reference: midnight on May 8, 1945, when the capitulation of the Nazi forces' high command came into effect, marking the end of World War II in Europe. The period immediately thereafter became known as the Nachkriegszeit ("time after the war").

In this game, the players asume the role of the reconstruction of Germany after the World War II, managing action cards, construction cards and event cards, that come into play using dices. At the end of the game, the player who has built more prestigious buildings will be the winner.



SPANISH:

Stunde Null es el equivalente en alemán de "la hora cero", un término prestado de la planificación militar que indica el comienzo de una operación o evento. En Alemania, Stunde Null tiene una referencia particular: medianoche del 8 de mayo de 1945, cuando capitularon las fuerzas nazis, dando fin así a la Segunda Guerra Mundial en Europa. El período inmediatamente posterior se conoce como Nachkriegszeit ("tiempo después de la guerra").

En este juego, los jugadores asumen el papel de reconstruir Alemania después de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, mediante la gestión de cartas de acción, construcción y sucesos, que se ponen en juego mediante el uso de dados. Al final de la partida, aquel que haya construido más edificios de prestigio será el vencedor.
188009.name: Stunde Null

188010.name: Skylanders Figures
188010.description:
Skylanders is a toys-to-life video game series published by Activision. Games in the series are played by placing character figures called the Skylanders on the "Portal of Power", a device that reads the figures' tags through NFC and "imports" the character represented by the figure into the game as a playable character.

Source: Wikipedia, "Skylanders", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188011.name: Steal 2.0 Player's Guide
188011.description:
From the introduction:

Steal 2.0 seeks to recreate the dangerous, frenetic world of the criminal underworld. From the tawdry lives of petty street urchins, right up to the sophisticated opulent lifestyles of bosses of international organized crime syndicates. Steal 2.0 expands the remit of the original release to allow for the recreation of different types of crime. Whether you want to be a thug, driver, security expert, computer hacker, identity thief, con artist, pimp, safe cracker, assassin, drug trafficker, forger, hard man, or crime boss; Steal 2.0 provides!

188012.name: Steal 2.0 Judge's Guide
188012.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Judge’s Guide for Steal 2.0. As you can see, this release is crammed full of factual material about organized crime and police operations. You would probably steal if it wasn’t already free. Don’t worry about the relative size of this volume, 99% of the information present is actually background material, and not laborious GM rules. The system is designed to be light and easy to both run and understand. The one chapter I do recommend skimming through though is Chapter 8: The Master Plotter. This chapter gives handy advice to both novice and experienced Games Masters about running criminal and police campaigns.

188013.name: Steal 2.0 Judge's Screen
188013.description:
From the introduction:

This bundle includes all of the additional resources needed to run Steal 2.0.

You should find various themed templates to play either Criminals, Police and Private Investigators. Also included is the generic second side of the theSpookEngine character sheet to help keep track of equipment and other issues. I've also recreated a classic version of Steal 1.0 character sheet for old time lags.

The character sheets have two spaces reserved for photos, one is for the placement of a company or force logo, the other is for the inclusion of a character portrait (criminals groups tend not to have logos, so I haven't included a second space there). You can find both police logos and character passport photos in theSpookEngine Controller's Screen bundle, the Brit-Ops Guide or source your own from the internet.

Also present are the panels needed to construct a Judge's Screen (GM Screen), print out the following sections and apply to a solid sheet of cardboard and fold into a gatefold arrangement. You might also like to apply some plastic film to help strengthen and preserve the screen. The Combat, First Aid and Miscellaneous sections go on the inside.

188014.name: 御用達 (Royal Warrant)
188014.description:
Set during the Edo period, 御用達 (Royal Warrant) pits the player merchants against one another in a castle town rules by a tiger lord. Players need to bribe influential people with their five bidding tokens (numbered 1-5) in order to acquire goods and deliver them to samurai.

Publisher's summary:
Players will be merchants of the animal land in fictional Japanese Edo era. In this game, they compete for the leader position. Each player has chips that are assigned value of 1-5 and they bid a chip, hiding the value each round.

In turn, each player puts a chip on any area of the board. After each player has put all their five chips on the board, the value of chips are revealed and the totals compared in each area. The player who put the highest value can use the special effect of the area. The effects are various. For example, you can get goods, you can win victory points, and so on. Once six rounds are over, the player with the most victory points is the winner.

Publisher's summary:
江戸時代の動物の国の商人になって、地位を競うゲームです。
各自1～5のチップを持っており、それを使ったブラインドの競りを毎ラウンド行います。手番が来たら自分のチップを1枚ボード上の好きなエリアに置きます。
全員が5枚のチップを置いたら、各エリアの数字を比べて大きい人がそのエリアの権利を得ます。商品を獲得したり、それを使って勝利点を獲得したりとエリアの効果は様々です。
6ラウンド終了時に、最も勝利点を獲得しているプレイヤーが勝者です。

188015.name: The Spook Engine: Volume 1
188015.description:
From the introduction:

The Spook Engine is designed to be a realistic covert operations RPG system, ever endeavor has been made to source verified factual material.

User summary:

The core rules for The Spook Engine were published in two volumes, intended to be utilized together. Both volumes were of approximately the same length (102 pp. and 119 pp., respectively). Topics, Chapters, and Pagination are continuous between the two volumes. This item, Volume 1, includes:


What is Roleplaying?
What is The Spook Engine?
Setting Advice for Players
Player Templates
Character Generation
Game Mechanics
Combat
Other Contested Skills
The Equipment Depot

188016.name: The Spook Engine: Volume 2
188016.description:
From the introduction:

The Spook Engine is designed to be a realistic covert operations RPG system, ever endeavor has been made to source verified factual material.

User summary:

The core rules for The Spook Engine were published in two volumes, intended to be utilized together. Both volumes were of approximately the same length (102 pp. and 119 pp., respectively). Topics, Chapters, and Pagination are continuous between the two volumes. This item, Volume 2, includes:


The Battlefield
The Laboratory
The Hospital
The Training Facilities
Command Headquarters
Handy Reference Tables
Glossary
Sample Agency - MI5
Further Modules

188017.name: The Spook Engine Player's Guide
188017.description:
From the introduction:

After September 11th the Western world has started to realize the naiveté of believing that foreign policy doesn’t impact upon domestic life; the failings of relying upon Signals Intelligence over Human Intelligence and the importance of protecting its borders and infrastructure.

This game seeks to recreate the covert world of intelligence and special operations for the modern world...

User summary:

This document was released in DOC format and was subtitled "Text Edition Version 1.2".

188018.name: Nine Tiles
188018.description:
In Nine Tiles, each player takes nine double-sided tiles, with each side of a tile having one of six images, and arranges them in a 3x3 gird. Each image appears a total of three times on the tiles, with it being paired with a different image in each of the three instances. (The sets of nine tiles are identical, and they have 1-4 dots on them to help players sort the tiles.)

Each round, one of the thirty goal cards is revealed, then players race to rearrange their tiles — flipping one tile at a time, or swapping two tiles — in order to make their nine tiles match the image shown on the card. Whenever a player thinks they've done this, they slap the card. If they're correct, they keep the card; if they're wrong, they still keep the card, but flipped face-down. If a player collect two face-down cards, they're out of the game.

The first play to collect four (face-up) cards wins!

By combining two sets of Nine Tiles, up to eight players can compete at once. When more than four people are in a game, reveal two of the thirty cards each round. Each player can claim at most one card in a round.

188019.name: Operations Guide: United Kingdom Operations Guide
188019.description:
User summary:

This sourcebook provides extensive information about United Kingdom spycraft, police work, and armed forces. It includes coverage of the United Kingdom and Ireland. Major types of data include:


Governments
Armed Forces
Intelligence Agencies
Police Authorities
Relevant Laws
Emergency Planning
Trouble
Maps & Logos

188020.name: God Wars: Future Past
188020.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

The story follows the conflicts of three nations set in ancient Japan. The game will feature over 30 jobs, 600 skills, and 200 weapons.

188021.description:
Doughnut Drive-Thru — a.k.a. パンパカパン (Panpakapan) — is a worker placement game set in a bakery, with players struggling in the narrow kitchen to create as much as they can.

Game #7 in 'The Mike Line' of games from Grail Games.
188021.name: Doughnut Drive-Thru

188022.name: Equipment Tricks for Backpacks
188022.description:
From publisher blurb:

With a wealth of feat options at a player’s disposal, it can be difficult to find something new to define your character. The Equipment Trick feat introduced new ways to specialize around the gear you use the most, differentiating your character from every other rank and-file adventurer.

With Sidebar: Equipment Tricks for Backpacks, you’ll find a dozen exciting new ways to employ this everyday gear in your game, both in and out of combat. You won’t want to leave home without it!

188023.name: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition
188023.description:
GOW Ultimate Edition feature five chapters of the campaign which were originally exclusively available in the PC version of the game. Gears of War Ultimate Edition was developed under the direction of series creator Rod Fergusson but is the first to be created at The Coalition, the Microsoft Studios studio charged with the continuation and development of the franchise following its acquisition by Microsoft in early 2014.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wikipedia-Page-Title," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188024.name: Spy-Fi
188024.description:
User summary:

In Spy-Fi characters have Attributes that are divided into Skills and Statistics. Skills are trained abilities; Statistics are natural or innate abilities. All Attributes have a value between 1 and 6 (low is better). During character build, players distribute twenty-four points among seven Basic Skills (Action, Brawl, Charisma, Detective, Espionage, Firearms, and Gaming). Characters may take an eighth Skill of their own creation by incurring an additional eight points in the pool. Skill scores can then be "min/maxed" so one score might be made a zero.

Characters then receive five of the ten Statistics, distributing seventeen points among the five so they have values of 1-6. The remaining five Statistics then are assigned a value of six each. During each session, characters receive Gambit Points and Penalty Points.

To resolve attempted actions, characters roll dice and try to "roll under" the relevant Attribute. Gambit Points can be spent to alter dice rolls. Penalty Points can be of several types: Bimbo, Uncool, Hazard, Stumble, Backstab, Wimp, Accident, Faux, Weenie, or Guilt. Generally, these points are adverse in action and must somehow be played out to be discarded. The game includes a rudimentary experience and advancement system.

188025.name: The Red Hatbox Affair
188025.description:
User summary:

The PCs must move a vital piece of computer equipment from a top-secret base just outside London to a top-secret base somewhere in Kent. It gets lost during transportation. The search will take the PCs to a crowded hat fair where they will discover a number of oddball characters. The McGuffin is hidden inside a red hatbox and the hat fair is full of red hatboxes. The PCs must find the correct hatbox before the enemy agents do.

188026.name: The Bards of Ur
188026.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bards of Ur is a Fifth Edition adventure for mid-level players that was voted to be massed released by the patrons of Genius Loci Games Patreon Program.

The Bards of Ur are the biggest troupe in the land. Their strange black-and-white make, their leather, spiked clothing, and strange heavy music is all the rage in every town they pass through. However, their music is the key to breaking the chains to a Demon Lord who has been imprisioned for a thousand years.

188027.name: Book of Uther
188027.description:
From the back cover:

It's Good to be the King…

Uther Pendragon is the king of warlords, the fiercest man in the land, bearer of the Sword of Victory and guardian of the honor of Britain. Uther has everything a man could want, except…

The Book of Uther explores the tumultuous life and times of King Uther Pendragon. This is the book for anyone craving more detail on the workings of the Royal Court. Hobnob with great barons, famous heroes, pious bishops, and reverent abbots. Gossip with the court knights who guard the king and their privileges with equal fervor. Travel with the king on his Progress, learn the extensive powers of his sheriffs, and witness the vastness of Uther's demesne. An all-new courtly scenario generator and rules for keeping the Rumor Mill grinding provide powerful tools to ensure that Player-knights have opportunities to directly interact with the royal court, ensuring their personal investment in this lofty setting.

Furthermore, the Book of Uther presents a never-before-seen, five-year expansion to the award-winning The Great Pendragon Campaign that gives the option for starting a campaign in Year 480, the fateful year that Uther inherits the crown and forges the kingdom that will one day be the birthright of his son, King Arthur.

188028.description:
Cards Against Humanity: Eight Sensible Gifts for Hanukkah was a holiday themed subscription in 2015 in which participants received 8 gags and gifts in the mail and worked together to solve a massive online puzzle. The gifts include 2 packs of cards - Jew Pack Part One and Jew Pack Part Two.

Night 4: Jew Pack Part One

White: 13
Black: 2




Night 7: Jew Pack Part Two

White: 12
Black: 3
188028.name: Cards Against Humanity: Eight Sensible Gifts for Hanukkah

188029.name: Stargate SG-1 (WEG D6)
188029.description:
User summary:

In 1998, author John Tynes was contracted with by West End Games to develop a role-playing game based on the Stargate SG-1 television series; the game was planned to use the successful WEG D6 System. After substantive development, West End Games experienced severe financial difficulties and the project was cancelled, leaving the game incomplete but also owned by the author. In 1999, the author published the materials which were completed as free HTML in these major sections:


Introductory materials
Character Creation
Attributes and Skills
How to be a Supervisor (Game Master)
The Rules (action resolution)
Combat

188030.description:
This supplement for the epic space strategy game Quantum includes alternate rules, bonus maps and answers to Frequently Asked Questions about Quantum.

Contains:

Rules - Quantum Entanglement rules
Expert F.A.Q. - additional F.A.Q.
Command Card Tips - several useful tips for Command cards
New Maps - 6 new maps specifically designed for shorter, intense games and for use with the Quantum Entanglement alternate rules.
Map Revisions - revised BETA SECTOR and NEXUS maps
Curious - revised Curious Command card
188030.name: Quantum: Entanglement Add-on Pack

188031.name: Stargate SG-13
188031.description:
A GURPS Lite Campaign Set in the World of the TV Show Stargate SG-1; Season 6 Edition

From the introduction:

Welcome to the universe of Stargate, where contemporary soldiers and scientists brush shoulders with spacefaring aliens, monstrous parasites, and beautiful damsels in distress.

To survive and prosper, your character will need a fast draw, a fast tongue, quick wits, and a sense of honour. Beware beings who look like gods, especially ones with glowing eyes; the Norse pantheon are OK, but the rest of 'em want to enslave you and steal your planet...

This history is drawn from the movie Stargate and the Stargate SG-1 TV show as far as the season 6.

188034.name: Starguild
188034.description:
User summary:

Character generation in Starguild begins with a personal history, then a homeworld determination. Characters have eight Attributes which are randomly determined using 3D6 each: Strength, Constitution, Dexterity, Agility, Intelligence, Education, Bravery, and Charisma. Characters then have various Aptitudes derived from Attribute values. A variety of other derived values are then calculated. Based on the character to this point, the player determines motivation and (optionally) limitations. Characters will select a role (Researcher, Survivalist, Technician, or Transport) which will provide various Skills and Skill values. Equipment allocation completes character generation.

Characters gain experience on a per-session basis and may utilize it in an attempt to gain aptitude in a Skill. Skill resolution and combat utilize dice rolls against target numbers. Combat can result in either Stun or Lethal damage, generally depending upon the type of weapon. Wounds are tracked "in a descriptive way" instead of using hit points.

188035.name: Volcano Cove
188035.description:
In Volcano Cove two warring nations discover gold mines within a disputed cove. To win the game, sink all enemy ships, or be the first to earn 7 gold. But watch out for the volcano. If your opponent’s prayers to the volcano gods are successful, lava could engulf your fleet.

Volcano Cove is a beautiful 2-player game that packs a large punch. Games last 10-15 minutes while providing drama and strategic decisions around every turn. Since there are multiple paths to victory, you’ll need to watch your opponent carefully and look for weaknesses you can exploit.

Both players share a zero-sum Gold Track. When you earn 1 gold your opponent loses 1 gold, and vice versa. This means when you buy extra ships or movement, you are giving your opponent gold in exchange for the advantage. You earn gold by sinking enemy ships, occupying gold mine spaces, having 3 Battle Coins at the end of your turn, and by praying to the volcano gods and successfully causing an eruption.

You start your turn by building your fleet, sailing, and declaring any battles you’d like. When fighting, your Battle Strength is equal to the number of coins that make up your ship (ships can be built up to 3 coins high) plus any Battle Coins you commit. Three Battle Coins float between both players throughout the game. If you commit a Battle Coin to a battle, you have a higher Battle Strength for the current battle, but you must pass any committed Battle Coins to your opponent.

After the Battle Phase, your opponent decides if he or she wants to pray to the volcano gods. If your opponent prays, he or she shakes 3 Prayer Coins. The number of heads shaken moves the Volcano Track marker, which can cause an eruption. Ships within the Lava Danger Zone when the volcano erupts take damage depending on the severity of the eruption. After the Pray Phase, you end you turn by earning gold from any gold mine spaces you still occupy. Then play passes to the next player.

To create your free print-and-play copy of Volcano Cove, print the board and rules at VolcanoCove.com and find 10 pennies, 10 nickels, 5 dimes, and 3 quarters. You now have everything you need to challenge someone to your first game.

188036.name: Read Only Memories

videogamehonor.40654: 2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Honorable Mention

188036.description:
User Summary

This adventure game is set in 2064 San Francisco. You play a journalist who -- together with your robot -- searches for the relationship between recent technological advances and humanity.

188038.name: Alekhine's Gun
188038.description:
It follows the format of Death to Spies and its sequel Death to Spies: Moment of Truth, developed by Haggard Games and released in 2007 and 2009 respectively. The game features open maps with multiple methods to complete levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Alekhine's Gun", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188039.name: King's Castle
188039.description:
EQUIPMENT: one 8-sided die; 4 playing pieces of four different colors; and the board, consisting of an oval, three-lane track with a separate, ten-space track in the center. What follows is my reconstruction of the rules.

SET UP: players group their pieces on the 'start' space of the central track. Turns are in alphabetical order of the colors.

GOAL: to get to the opposite side of the central track, the 'finish' space, a mere nine spaces away. An exact throw is not needed.

MOVEMENT: players take turns rolling the d8, moving that many spaces counter-clockwise. Several spaces are connected by arrows-if you land on the end of one, go to its head; if on its head, go to the tail. If you land on another player, that person goes back to 'start.' Landing on the fifth space of the central track also sends one back to 'start.'

188040.name: Fly Away Jack & Jill
188040.description:
EQUIPMENT: a 48-card deck consisting of four suits: Fly Away Jill, Fly Away Jack, Come Back Jill, Come Back Jack. Each contains 12 cards ranked (lowest to highest) 1-9 plus A, B, C.

SET UP: shuffle the cards and deal evenly to all players. Person to left of dealer goes first.

PLAY: The first player lays down a card and the other players must follow suit-the highest card played (of the leading suit) wins the 'trick' (all played cards) and leads the next card. When all cards have been played scores are tallied. ONLY Fly Away Jacks are counted.

GOAL: To be the person with the LOWEST score after three rounds-meaning, having taken the FEWEST Fly Away Jacks.

188041.name: Steampunk Mafia
188041.description:
User summary:

Characters have five Stats (Attributes): Body, Dexterity, Charm, Intelligence, and Will. Character Stats begin at zero; players distribute 4 points among their Stats at creation. The game does allow "min/maxing" on Stats. Characters have one or more Descriptors which are narrative tags that describe skills or abilities. Characters have 5 points to distribute among their Descriptors. The game also allows "min/maxing" on Descriptor scores. Characters then have a History generated. Characters typically begin play with a "Kodiak", or mecha suit. Action resolution involves rolling a modified 2D6 and comparing against a Difficulty Number. Rolling double-ones means critical failure, rolling double-fours (called a "Lucky Eight") means critical success.

188042.name: Stellar Sanctums
188042.description:
User summary:

Characters in Stellar Sanctums have eight Basic Stats (Strength, Agility, Health, Intelligence, Will, Virtue, Vice, and Perception), generally rated from -5 to +5. The rules suggest using D100 and trying to "roll under" the appropriate Basic Stat (which makes no sense, but that's the rule--see image). Opposed rolls (e.g., personal combat) work similarly. A Task Result Table is used to determine outcome based on the roll and the action type.

The rules also present a separate method for handling "Vehicle" (smallish) and "Ship" (largish) movement and combat. These rules are not similar to the character rules, but generally do use percentile rolls. Mecha are handled under the "Vehicle" rules.

188043.name: Stranger of Sword City
188043.description:
User Summary

Stranger of Sword City is a dungeon crawler. The game features a range of classes to choose from, customization options for each character, turn based combat and resource gathering.

188044.name: Stellar Sanctums Revisions
188044.description:
User summary:

Several revisions are presented to correct or clarify the basic Stellar Sanctum rules. These are presented as four individual HTML pages:


Variable Dice Rules
Alternative Weapon Rules
Generic Star-Fighter Design
Fleet Rules


Variable Dice Rules clarifies character build rules by establishing a Point Pool for Stats during build, introducing Hit Points and Skills with Skill Levels. Generally speaking, the original game is not playable without these rules.

Alternative Weapon Rules implements damage dice by weapon type, considers armors, and attempts a slight reconciliation between character and vehicle systems.

Generic Star-Fighter Design provides a simpler system for ship building and handling.

Fleet Rules presents a method for handling multiple ship combat. A spreadsheet is included to assist with calculations.

188045.name: Stellar Sojourn
188045.description:
User summary:

In Stellar Sojourn character creation is involved. First, a Species (Race) is selected (from about twenty options), and then a Homeworld is selected. Next, Attributes are generated; Attributes include Strength, Quickness, Endurance, Intelligence, Will, Guile, Perception, Charisma, and Luck. Attributes are modified and/or limited by Species but otherwise are randomly generated with 2D10. Several Secondary Traits are then derived, including Body Combat Fighting Skill, Throwing Fighting Skill, Shooting Fighting Skill, Dodging Fighting Skill, and several others. The character is then provided a rudimentary background by generating possible Life Events (some Life Events will cause character revision, usually minor). Characters next generate Skills and Skill Levels, a numeric rating for each Skill running from 1-10. There are ten groups of Skills, each with several individual Skills. Finally, a series of random Details are either generated or derived to complete character creation.

A separate major section of the rules details the Setting. Extensive information is provided but mostly it is of a fairly generic/vanilla nature.

188046.name: Kung-Fu Card Fight
188046.description:
The Student Becomes the Master!

Your Sensei is aging and it's time to name a successor that will carry on your schools Kung-Fu Legacy. Display your honor, martial prowess, and harness your chi to unleash power techniques from 5 classic kung-Fu styles. Defeat your rival students and become the next Kung-Fu Master!

Kung-Fu Card Fight is a fast paced deckbuilding card game. Blending elements of classic deckbuilding games with a cinematic combat system, Kung-Fu Card Fight captures iconic fight sequences from Martial Arts Films.

Kung-Fu Card Fight contains two 15 card starter decks, one 50 card master deck, 20 chi tokens, 2 stamina tokens, and one stamina tracking board.

188047.name: Radium
188047.description:
User Summary

The aim is to negotiate a ball from a start to end hole. Sometimes the two controls pull the ball towards themselves (green) and sometimes the two controls push the ball away (yellow). There are other hazards and changes to the screen. The other aim is to do so in a set time in order to unlock other screens.

188048.description:
Promo Card for Castle Assault.

Epic Neutral Unit
Cost: 3
Stats: 2, 4, 0, 1
Ranged Linear (1-6)
188048.name: Castle Assault: Sir Mitchell Greencastle Promo Card

188049.description:
Promo Card for Castle Assault.

Epic Neutral Command (Attachment)
Cost: 1
Target Unit gains: Loses 1 Health at the End of its turn
188049.name: Castle Assault: Dagger of Ill Omen Promo Card

188050.name: Vertix
188050.description:
This is a massively multiplayer online action packed arcade game utilizing the power of web sockets and node.js.

Source: The Developer Website.

188051.description:
Deadfall is a gambling / bluffing game. Players ante one coin to begin and start with a hand of six cards. Everyone plays one card, and the lowest of these will go first.

On your turn you may either play a new card face up or call one of your opponents. When you play a card, you are trying not to play the last card of that rank. For example, if you play a 5, you are declaring that someone's hand still contains a 5. If you have one, you know you're safe. If not, you're making an educated guess.

A call ends the hand. When you call another player, you are saying that they were wrong when they played their last card, and there are no more cards of that rank left in anyone's hand. If the caller is right, she wins the pot, plus a penalty equal to the rank of the card, paid by the called player. (For example, 7 coins for calling a 7.) If the caller is wrong, the called player wins the pot, and he wins the same penalty from the caller.

There are two ways to get ahead in Deadfall: You can catch people when they play the wrong cards, and you can trick others into calling you when you're safe.
188051.name: Deadfall

188052.description:
One Hit Kill: Death & Lore Expansion brings two new components, two associated special cards and 16 new weapons to build. Expansion pack supports up to six players.

Every expansion pack requires the Core deck. Most weapons in an expansion pack use a mix of core classes and expansion classes.
