Traps are wonderful, diabolical machinations (and there are certainly traps in this book) but by themselves these tricky mechanisms don't have the layer of world building that we were looking for.

We kept asking ourselves: "What can we could do to bring these traps to life in our world?", and finally, the thought clicked that what we needed to do was explore "who brought these traps to life in our world?" And that's exactly what this supplement focuses on. Yes we'll show you some traps — but not just traps alone — you’ll also meet the people who made them.

Welcome to The Trapsmiths of Dragongrin, a dossier of four distinct trap makers - each with a signature trap of their own custom design. Not only will we describe the trap at length for use in your game, but also give you an insight on who built it and why. We had quite a lot of fun creating it, and we hope you enjoy it.

188167.name: Brass

videogamehonor.34514: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game App Nominee

188167.description:
Story
Brass is a demanding economic game. An outstanding game about money and monopolies. Players take the roles of entrepreneurs attempting to make the most money from various industries during the Industrial Revolution. Each player needs to build an economic engine that surpasses all the others.

BUILD
Industries are the key to success. Will you become a Cotton Magnate owning the most Cotton Mills in Lancashire? Or do you prefer selling Coal and Iron to others? Ports and Shipyards are key constructions as well, since the others cannot function without them in the long term.

CONNECT
Build canals and later rails to connect towns and cities. Only then can you benefit from all the industries built in the country, even those built by your opponents!

DEVELOP
R&D is essential. The better developed industries you have, the more effective they are. Should others neglect development, your path to victory will be easier.

TRADE
It’s not what you have produced, but the thing you sold that makes ‘brass’ (said with a thick Yorkshire accent – ‘brass’ being a local term for money). Watch the markets carefully and sell at the proper time!

WIN
Use the produced supplies and activate Industries, upgrade rails, save money. The most effective entrepreneur is the winner.
Brass Iron Works
Brass Coal Mine
Brass Shipyard
Brass Port

Features
3 or 4 players per game
AI opponent
Network multiplayer with push notifications
Local multiplayer (pass & play)
Refreshed artwork
Works in any orientation (portrait & landscape)
In-game tutorial & manual
Achievements and leaderboards

188168.name: Hellraid: The Escape
188168.description:
Hellraid: The Escape is a video game set within the Hellraid universe. Unlike Hellraid, The Escape puts emphasis on puzzle-solving instead of action.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hellraid", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188169.name: Superteens
188169.description:
User summary:

Characters have Attributes, including Brains, Brawn, Looks, Cool, Luck, Health, Wits, and Tech. Abilities have numeric scores generated by 1D6. Characters also have 1D6 points to put into Talents (Skills) in any combination desired. Skills are not provided but a few are offered as samples (Photography, Getting a Date, and Staking Vampires). Characters also have a Superpower, randomly determined from a list of eighteen. Characters then select two virtues, one vice, and a Quirk. Characters that are at least sixteen years old also have a car; all characters receive and allowance.

Action resolution, including combat, has the player roll 1D10 and add any applicable modifier. Simultaneously the GM rolls 1D10 and adds the Difficult Rating. If the player result exceeds the GM result, the action succeeds.

188170.description:
A Promo card that was released as part of the Car Wars Arenas Kickstarter Campaign. It was a reward to the $40 and higher pledge levels.

The card's ability is this:

Out of Control

Play against an opponent IMMEDIATELY after they play a Spin, Swerve, or Bootlegger Reverse. That player loses their next turn.
188170.name: Car Wars: The Card Game – Out of Control Promo Card

188171.description:
A Promo card that was released as part of the Car Wars Arenas Kickstarter Campaign. It was a reward to the $40 and higher pledge levels.

The card's ability is this:

Body Armor

Play at any time, up until your driver takes damage from an Attack card. This acts as Armor (3) against the first such Attack played against you. If played IMMEDIATELY after the attack, it also works against that attack.
188171.name: Car Wars: The Card Game – Body Armor Promo Card

188172.name: Players Handbook
188172.description:
User summary:

The Players Handbook contains the lion's share of the rules for the game the Theatre of the Adsurb. The game utilizes several typical elements of role-playing games in atypical ways; to highlight this, the author frequently uses non-standard terms for objects or processes. For example, the game master is referred to as the Director and the role is supposed to change hands every three or four sessions. The game also uses an Effects Table (Action Table) to resolve some actions, and action resolution uses a somewhat complex process.

Characters have an Intensity (Level) that determines how well they can do certain things. A character's Intensity increases when they accumulate enough Effort Points (Experience Points). Characters select a Phylla (Type), Race, Sex, and a Calling which is vaguely analogous to Class. Characters have Abilities (Attributes) in Mental (Fortitude, Knowledge, Charisma, Intuition, Stability) and Physical (Vitality, Muscle, Physique, Reflexes, Durability) groups. Fortitude and Vitality are "special" Parent Abilities, because the establish Current Fortitude (Sanity) and Current Vitality (Hit Points), scores that fluctuate during play. Characters also have Preoccupations which are a complex attribute that declares focus and interest.

The game's Action Tables are provided as a separate PDF download.

188173.name: GASP
188173.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

GASP takes place in the same universe as Secluded. You control a lone astronaut that lands on the surface of a planet and must meet up with the other astronauts before running out of air.

188174.name: Directors Handbook
188174.description:
User summary:

The Directors Handbook has very few "rules" but much advice for Directors of the Theatre of the Adsurb. Major topics in this short document include non-player character development, developing a setting, creating and running adventures, and handing out experience points.

The Director role in the game is supposed to rotate among players every approximately four game sessions which is a form of game balance.

188175.name: Developers Handbook
188175.description:
From the introduction:

Players, Directors, Developers. The three grow out of one another quite naturally. The desire to play the game turns into the desire to host a game which then turns into the desire to change the game to ones needs. For most Role Playing Games the desire is stifled at the directing level, directors could and often did create their own monsters and magical items and game worlds but ultimately these innovations never ventured far from the games of the people who invented them. Official game design trickled down the stone-walled ramparts of distant game companies who were not exactly deaf to the needs of their players but were often distant, physically inaccessible, and seemingly resentful of having to deal with the contributions of their co-workers let alone all the anonymous Joes & Janes who played their games.

Nowadays, thanks in part to the internet, no one is blissfully out of touch from anything yet a stone wall of bureaucracy seems to stand between the people who design the games and those who play them.

Not with the Theatre of the Adsurb.

188176.name: Race Creation Handbook
188176.description:
From the introduction:

Race Creation resembles Character Creation in that a race starts with a set amount of Vitae (the race creation version of the effort point) which the player building the race then invests in different attributes which will ultimately influence the lives of those born into that race. The mindset of race creation – however – runs on a completely different track. Where in character creation there is an unspoken competition with players vying to create the most powerful character possible for a certain intensity level, the purpose of vitae in race creation is to balance out all the different races grouped into a phyla; primarily so that no single one becomes the favorite of the game by way of its disproportionate power, thus dooming all the others to extinction through disregard.

188178.description:
Battle the dark powers of Draconis in the ultimate medieval fantasy deck-building game.

With over 500 beautifully illustrated cards, Draconis Invasion is a fast-paced deck-builder for 1-6 opponents, lasting approximately 45 minutes, with hordes of Invaders attacking your kingdom, and players racing to gather armies, gold, and special action cards to fight the enemy. Unlike other deck-building card games, Draconis Invasion incorporates hidden Campaign cards that reward points for killing specific Invaders, Terror cards and the Terror Die that add a doomsday clock so that your armies become tired and weak as time passes, and triggered Event cards that target the game-leader with potentially disastrous effects. Kill 6 Invaders or exhaust the Events cards to end the game. When the dust settles, only one hero will stand victorious as the realm's greatest champion.
188178.name: Draconis Invasion

188179.name: Doctor Who: Companions
188179.description:
Doctor Who: Companions is a challenging cooperative boardgame based on the well-known BBC TV Show. Each player will assume the role of one of the 13 last companions of the Doctor and try to protect 4 regions from famous Doctor Enemies such as the Daleks, the Cybermen, or any of the 9 types of enemies you might encounter.

During the game, players will draw cards and use symbols on theirs cards to perform various actions such as move across the boards, travel through time, fight, meet famous characters, rest, train population, search special sites for items,call the Doctor for help... They'll have to watch for the enemies moves and special plan, and time their actions to counter them.

Players win the game if they manage to clean the board from enemies before the activation deck is depleted for the second time. If not, the world will be submitted to an hostile alien race...

218674.name: Avignon: A Clash of Popes: Heretic Promo

188181.description: Avignon is a quick influence manipulation card game in which the two players are rival candidates for Pope in the 14th century. Players gain influence by petitioning members of the medieval Church, such as Cardinals, Nobles, and Knights, and using the characters' unique powers to pull the character cards over to their side of the table (their congregation), or force an opponent to push cards towards them. The first player to get three characters into their congregation wins.
188181.name: Avignon: A Clash of Popes

188182.name: Anhkheg Dilemma
188182.description:
From publisher blurb:

This week’s Filbar offering is FQ7 – Anhkheg Dilemma. While the PCs continue the quest for the missing pages of the Codex of Gamber Dauch they find the lands of Count Elam. The ruler has recently been informed of an agricultural problem with a herd of Anhkheg tearing up the lush farmland. Further investigation will uncover darker secrets in the area, and those involving Drow and Derro!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Quest Campaign for a group of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

188183.name: $7000 DOLLAR MOV1E: The Squeal
188183.description:
From publisher blurb:

$7000 Dollar Movie is a story roleplaying game about passionate people making the sequel to a dreadful B-Movie. That original “film” languished for years before finally being released to a limited number of screens. Portions of the film were damaged from years of neglect. That, along with production problems, delays, illness, and actor changes, meant the final piece played out like a glitter-stained collage of leftover jigsaw pieces. All the while, the characters appeared as nothing more than random bits of nonsense drawn from the imagination of a confused screenwriter. Needless to say it became a cult classic.

Encouraged by these surprising results, the director used the profits to pay back investors (parents) and fund a sequel. But can he duplicate the previous madness on purpose or will it be the bomb critics are anticipating?

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

188184.name: The Arsenal of Democracy
188184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes, justice can be profitable. Or, security can be anyway. The Arsenal of Democracy are a privatized team of metahumans for hire with the support personnel, equipment, and systems to keep them operating at peak efficiency in the field. Their name and image bought from the US government by corporate concerns, the market has turned Uncle Sam's failed experiment in national superteams into a highly effective and quite profitable international security asset. Are you ready to face the Arsenal to get at their clients? Becasue they say they're ready for you...

The Arsenal of Democracy is a team of characters (PLs averaging 10), with supporting personnel and vehicles, to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

188185.name: Autumn Special
188185.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

This special volume is three times the length of a normal Deadly Gardens volume and the material all has a horror / occult theme as well as the natural wilderness theme. It also contains a mini-adventure that draws heavily on the included material.

In this volume:

Brain Pumpkin CR 5
Pumpkin-Headed Creature Template
4 Pumpkin-Headed Creatures: Pumpkin-Headed Bull, Pumpkin-Headed Goblin, Pumpkin-Headed Hound and Pumpkin-Headed Villager
Gloom Bough CR 8
Vengeful Creature Template
3 Vengeful Creatures: Vengeful Bones, Vengeful Ghast, Vengeful Wraith
6 Haunts: A Murder of Spirits, Despair of Victory, Grasping Dead, Suffer No Apologies, Thundering Death, Together in Death
4 Natural Items: Brain Pumpkin Pulp, Gloom Bough Heartwood, Necrotic Flesh, Skeletal Powder
Rules for using Brain Pumpkin Pulp and Gloom Bough Heartwood as Natural Power Components for spellcasting.
1 Magic Item: Spirit Cudgel

188188.description:
A corrupt city, subject to vice and avarice, is under the control of vile characters. The seat of power is vacant and waiting for you to take it — unless someone else takes it first.

In Complots, as in the original game Coup, you control two characters and start with two coins, and through trickery, manipulation and bluffing, you want to eliminate all other players who stand in your way, possibly by having them eliminate one another along the way.

The 24-card deck includes four copies of six different characters, each with a unique set of powers:


Duke: Take three coins from the treasury. Block someone from taking foreign aid.
Assassin: Pay three coins and try to assassinate another player's character.
Contessa: Block an assassination attempt against yourself.
Captain: Take two coins from another player, or block someone from stealing coins from you.
Ambassador: Draw two character cards from the Court (the deck), choose which (if any) to exchange with your face-down characters, then return two. Block someone from stealing coins from you.
Inquisitor: Draw one character card from the deck and choose whether or not to exchange it with one of your face-down characters, or force an opponent to show you one of their character cards (their choice). If you wish, you may then force them to draw a new card from the deck. They then shuffle the old card into the deck. Block someone from stealing coins from you.


(Either the Ambassador or the Inquisitor can be used in a game, not both.)

On your turn, you can take any of the actions listed above, regardless of which characters you actually have in front of you, or you can take one of three other actions:


Income: Take one coin from the treasury.
Foreign aid: Take two coins from the treasury.
Coup: Pay seven coins and launch a coup against an opponent, forcing that player to lose an character. (If you have ten coins or more, you must take this action.)


When you take one of the character actions – whether actively on your turn, or defensively in response to someone else's action – that character's action automatically succeeds unless an opponent challenges you. In this case, if you can't (or don't) reveal the appropriate character, you lose an influence, turning one of your characters face-up. Face-up characters cannot be used, and if both of your characters are face-up, you're out of the game.

If you do have the character in question and choose to reveal it, the opponent loses a character of their own, then you shuffle that character into the deck and draw a new one, perhaps getting the same character again and perhaps not.

The last player to still have a face-down character wins the game!
188188.name: Complots

188189.description: Complots: Saint Barthélemy adds two new characters to Complots, with four copies of each character, as well as rules for the new Hospice card.
188189.name: Complots: Saint Barthélemy

188190.name: Monopoly: Here & Now (Buzzfeed edition)
188190.description:
Travel around the gameboard visiting America's most exciting places.
Pay for the stamps of the places you land on and put them in your passport.
Charge other players vistor fees to stop at places you have stamps for.
The first player to fill their passport wins!

Different than traditional Monopoly (even previous "Here & Now" Editions) - there are no houses, hotels, or even title deeds. The goal isn't to bankrupt other players (in fact, the rules say if you are out of money, just don't pay - but keep playing). The goal of each player is to fill their own "Passport".

This game plays fare more like Monopoly Empire than Monopoly.

188192.name: Gogglebox TV Trivia Board Game
188192.description: Gogglebox is a fun-packed TV trivia board game based on the BAFTA winning observational documentary series. Gogglebox can be played by up to four players or in teams. Each starting on the nearest ‘Start’ space to them the players must successfully negotiate their way around the coloured squares on the board answering TV trivia, ad break questions as well as questions on the Goggleboxers themselves to try and win Gogglebox tokens. Each player takes it in turn to roll the die and move onto the appropriate space, different colour spaces represent different types of question or activity. Landing on a yellow space can mean having to return some of your Gogglebox tokens or steal some extra ones! The TV Trivia includes questions such as ‘Who called the Queen a ‘top bird’? and ‘Name the island where Father Ted is set’. The Gogglebox space means it’s a multiple choice question on the Goggleboxers themselves! This fun-packed game is perfect for after dinner entertaining or just for playing with friends and fans of the show. It is certainly guaranteed to test your TV trivia knowledge!

188196.name: Ravenous River
188196.description:
In Ravenous River, each player takes the role of an animal trying to cross the river. The roles are hidden, so you don't know which players are predator or prey. Be careful not to end up on a boat with the wrong animal, or you'll end up as its lunch! Use your feral cunning to trap your prey on the same boat for a tasty treat while you cross the river. The player who scores the most points by crossing the river, eating their prey, and avoiding being eaten themselves wins!

In more detail, Ravenous River includes seven animals, with each animal (e.g., horse) having a predator (bull) and a prey (hound). At the start of each round, each player secretly receives an animal card, and they want to feed that animal and get it safely home. Shuffle seven animal cards, then place them face down in a row on the riverbank. Place two boat cards near this bank; each boat can hold at most two animals. Deal each player two action cards. On a turn, a player either:


Places an animal: The player looks at animal card, then either places it face up on a boat or discards an action card and places it face down on the riverbank again.
Moves an animal: The player discards an action card, then either moves an animal from a boat to the bank or from the bank to a boat.
Plays an action card: The player discards an action card and performs that action.


If a player has no cards in hand at the end of their turn and both boats are full, players simultaneously vote on whether to end the round or not. If they do end it, players first see who eats whom on the riverbank, then who eats whom on each boat, then they unload the animals at home on the far side of the river, then again see who eats whom. Each animal scores 1 victory point (VP) for each animal eaten, unless it was eaten in turn in which case the point passes to its predator. Surviving animals score 1 VP on the bank and 2 VP at home.

If a single player has 6 or more VP, the game ends and that player wins. If no one has more than 6 VP or multiple players are tied with 6 or more VP, then the game continues for another round.

188197.name: Death Tales
188197.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Death has worked tirelessly to take the lives and souls of humans. Constantly ending the lives of innocents and corrupt alike began to take its toll on her and she soon grew lonely and depressed. Eventually, she fell in love with a mortal man. After much debate with her sisters, she chose to disobey them and granted her lover immortality and in doing so, created the first Reaper.

boardgameimplementation.147883: Lost Legacy: Hyakunen Senso to Ryu no Miko

188198.description:
Lost Legacy: Vorpal Sword is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
End: If there is at least one card left in the deck, the turn goes to the next player; if not, the investigation phase starts. Using the investigation speed indicated on the card each player has in hand, players take turns guessing which player (whether yourself or someone else) holds the "Lost Legacy" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. The player who guesses correctly wins; if no one finds the Lost Legacy, then everybody loses.


By combining different Lost Legacy sets (while keeping only a single Lost Legacy card in play), up to six players can compete at the same time.
188198.name: Zaginione Dziedzictwo: Gwiezdne Ostrze

188201.name: The Time Traveller
188201.description:
User summary:

The Time Traveller is an adaptation of the Dr. Who television series to table-top role-playing. The system presented is a modified and adapted version of White Wolf's Storyteller System. Characters have Attributes which have Ratings numbered 0-6, which determines how many dice are in the pool for that Attribute. Attributes include Dexterity, Knowledge, Mechanical, Perception, Strength, and Technical. The player distributes 18 points (hence, dice) among them. Characters also have a list of Skills, with 24 points (hence, dice) divided among them. Characters purchase Advantages by spending Character Points. Finally, characters are equipped.

The HTML game is presented in two major sections: Rule Book and Supplements. There is little to differentiate the two entries--supplements tend to be lists of things. The Rule Book section includes: Game Mechanics, Character Creation, Template Types, Character Skill List, Special Ability List, Species List, Game Systems, and Combat Systems. The Supplements section includes: Merits & Flaws, Antagonist List, Biodata Extracts, Block-Transfer Rotes, Vehicles & Movement, and Equipment List.

188202.name: Bounty Hunter: 1881
188202.description:
The American southwest: 1881. The “iron horses” are operating in these parts regularly now, and the turn of the century is near. The rise of cities out here is clearly on the event horizon, as ever-increasing numbers of “civilized” easterners move in. Yep, the old ways are about to end. Still, law and order largely remain in their formative years. Wanted posters circulate throughout the region, and bounty hunters are plentiful….

In Bounty Hunter: 1881, you are one of these rough-and-tumble men. You’ll obtain wanted posters and travel by train, stagecoach and on horseback to get to outlaws’ hideouts. Once located, you’ll try to apprehend your quarry, by fair means or foul. Be aware, however, that bounty hunters start out with a bad reputation. If you bushwhack too many wrongdoers you’ll be considered just as bad — or even worse. You’ll also have to be careful when apprehending your prey, since most of them are quite capable of getting the draw on you! So saddle up, pard’ner and let’s make some money — bounty hunter style!

Game Play (simplified): After a quick setup, a player will choose one of several possible actions, usually selecting one of the three Travel cards on display at the bottom of the board, along with its associated bonus. These bonuses are, left to right: draw an Outlaw card, draw an On The Trail card, take a silver dollar from the display. Each type of card has a hand limit, and players may need to pay dollars in order to discard unwanted cards. Players travel to the location where an outlaw was last seen via Train cards, then play an On The Trail card along with the Travel shown cards on it to try to apprehend an Outlaw card in his hand, which is accomplished via rolls of the dice, and may be attempted by fair means or foul. If successful via the latter method, one or more Black Marks are taken, but there is a limit. Players can be wounded by their quarry and lose turns. The game ends when the Travel deck has been exhausted three times– so shuffle the discards after it runs out the first and second times. The rewards for the outlaws captured/ bushwhacked are totaled and $300 deducted from the player with more Black Marks. The player with the higher total wins.

188203.name: Tribal Earth

rpg.28302: CARE: The Card Action Resolution Engine

188203.description:
User summary:

Tribal Earth presents a setting of a modern fantasy environment using the CARE system. The setting is based around five major "tribes" of sentient beings that have often-conflicting goals and desires. The setting provides an overview; a timeline; notes on character creation, skills, and equipment; and details about the four mundane tribes, including: Humans, Were, Shaper, and Undead. An additional tribe, Deus, is not available to characters. A few special tribes also are presented, including Mimics, Lichs, and Vampires.

188204.description: Try to get rid of your goat-cards by rolling the dice. If you roll the right combination, you can discard a goat card. If you don't, you have to pick up a card.
188204.name: De 7 geitjes

188205.name: Sleeper: Orphans of the Cold War

rpg.28938: Sleeper: Orphans of the Cold War

188205.description:
From the introduction:

This book contains all the rules and background needed to run a game of Sleeper. This includes rules for adjudicating combat and risky actions, several pre-generated characters and rules for making your own, advice for the GM, equipment and powers that can be given to players, and a system for increasing player characters’ capabilities by researching and developing new weapons and gear. It also includes lots of information on the world of Sleeper and the factions who inhabit it, including Obsidian, the organisation to which the player characters are assumed to belong. It includes many enemies to throw at the PCs, both generic soldiers and other enemies to be used as required and named characters from the Sleeper background. It also has a sample mission, which can both be played straight out of the book and used as an example of the kind of action-packed military-style adventures Sleeper characters find themselves on.

188206.name: Mini-Expansion: Baron

rpg.28938: Sleeper: Orphans of the Cold War

188206.description:
User summary:

This mini-expansion for the game presents Baron, a fully-developed character that can be used either as a player character or a non-player character. Background, special power ("Chaos Warp"), and three variant character sheets (landscape) are included in the document.

188207.name: M12 Rules System: The Truth Is Out There

rpg.28939: M12 Rules System: The Truth Is Out There

188207.description:
User summary:

In the M12 Rules System, characters have four Psychological Characteristics (Attributes) and four Physical Characteristics - the two groups each have Strength, Resistance, Manipulation, and Agility. Characteristics have a Dice Score of 2-6 (the rules support either pool purchase or randomization or array distribution). Characters have other traits defined such as State of Mind, Field of Expertise (very roughly analogous to a Class), and Skills. Skills have a Base Value which is a negative number that must be overcome before the character is considered "skilled". Skills are purchased from a large point pool resulting in highly skilled characters.

The M12 Rules System utilizes dice pools of D12 against a target number of successes. The dice pool size is determined by the relevant Characteristic's Dice Score. This is modified by the character's Skill rating (if appropriate) to find a resolution number which is compared against a Difficult Level.

The Truth Is Out There is a specific genre and setting for the M12 Rules System (apparently, the only one ever created). It adapts the X-Files television series to table-top role-playing. Characters are "Agents", investigating paranormal phenomena.

188208.name: Deepvault: Machinations of the Ancients
188208.description:
From publisher blurb:

This groundbreaking supplement includes:

39 pages of lore, inspiration, and official details on the Dragongrin campaign setting
3 legendary new monsters (including a powerful “anti-dragon”!)
Invaluable information on three of the distinct locations within the world of Dragongrin
New unique, playable races, ready to dive into the ‘Vault!




18 adventure-spurring plot hooks

Unique new familiars from another plane of existence
3 unique and powerful magic items to spice up your game world
Roll tables to create your own legendary weapon
New organizations, complete with lush history and backgrounds




Deepvault is an ancient and massive sentient tunnel system in the world of Dragongrin, created by the Titans as a refuge for their most precious technology and knowledge. The vault was sealed eons ago, and the Titans are believed to have retreated into its depths to one day emerge to create a new beginning after the Oldest War. Deepvault has now been opened, and the power of the long-dead Titans has been unleashed.
Deepvault: Machinations of the Ancients is a thick slab of gonzo fantasy, marinated in magitech sci-fi, and grilled over a smoldering bed of Tabletop Terrors charcoal. It's a little weird, a little mad, and a whole lot of awesome.

188209.name: Horror at Misty Meadows
188209.description:
From publisher blurb:

The trees creak in the noxious breeze. The heavy fog clings to your cloak, chilling you to the bone. A faint moan echoes through the wood, and a light appears in the distance, bobbing up and down, drawing closer and closer...
Absolute Adventures: Horror at Misty Meadows is a dangerous and horrifying experience for a party of adventurers of mid-to-high level. From the terrors that await your players in the ever-thickening fog pervading the town, to what’s boiling at the bottom of the tar pits, many adventurers may never see what awaits in the caves of this mining town…

19 pages of bone-chilling content.
Five unique and horrifying monsters.
A terrifying horror adventure, complete with three atmospheric locations.
Detailed maps for each unique location.
Multiple roll tables with magical madness effects.
A cinematic story experience with optional horror plot twists.




This adventure is made to stretch and tax your players to their limits. While the themes of horror are tangible throughout this supplement, the adventure stays within the bounds of PG-13 in terms of violence, gore, and other elements of horror.

188210.name: Riptide Raid
188210.description:
From publisher blurb:

Absolute Adventures: Riptide Raid! is a swift and silent adventure involving the dispatching of privateers aboard their multi-leveled vessel. This supplement is designed to challenge a party of low-level adventurers and is suitable for use with your favorite fantasy roleplaying game.

11 pages packed with adventure
A heist adventure that takes place on multiple decks of a ship
A privateer crew that will challenge any low-level group of adventurers
A reference map for each of the ship’s three levels
Alternate inspiration for tailoring the adventure to fit your needs
Half a dozen monstrous crew concepts for re-skinning the privateers
...and more!

188211.name: Goblin Go-Karts
188211.description:
From publisher blurb:

This amazing supplement includes:

A Fast-and-Furious Combat Encounter Featuring Death-Racing Goblins
Traps, Monsters, and Other Unique Obstacles to Challenge Players
Battle Map of Abandoned Mines Included
Lore to Inspire Your Game and Invigorate Your Campaign




These dilapidated, abandoned mines once glittered with silver and gemstones. But the din of shovels and pickaxes has faded from the tunnels – replaced with the grinding of metal wheels and the savage hoots and hollers of MUZZLEWICK’S MAULERS, the baddest gang of go-karting goblin blood racers to ever roll down the tracks. With spears and bottles of burning grease and their death machine FASTKILL, these goblins will seriously ruin your day.
Absolute Encounters: Goblin Go-Karts! is a fast-and-furious encounter involving kart-racing goblin gangs in an abandoned mine. This supplement is suitable for use with your favorite fantasy roleplaying game.

188212.name: Heirs of Desperation: Poverty In Your Campaign
188212.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed to simultaneoulsy offer a detailed supplement about the horrors of poverty, every sale of this supllement raises money to fight real world poverty in India (all proceeds beyond the cost of creation and distribution going to Hands of Freedom.

3 New Monsters
12 New Plot Hooks
1 New NPC
Detailed information on each topic: hunger, water shortage, and orphans




Heirs of Desperation - Poverty In Your Campaign is a supplement designed to raise money to fight real world poverty in India, with all proceeds beyond the cost of creation and distribution going to Hands of Freedom (HoF). While we fully support HoF, we are not formally affiliated with them in any way other than financial support. The opinions and ideas expressed in this supplement are those of the authors and do not reflect the opinions of HoF, their partners or their affiliates.

188213.name: Be A Better Faction Master
188213.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement includes:

19 pages of inspiring content.
A simple, five-step process to creating a great faction.
A streamlined faction-generator, allowing for nearly 5,000 unique combinations!
A massive faction name-generator, containing hundreds of names divided into ten uniquely-themed categories.
12 intriguing faction leaders, ready to take control of the organizations in your game world.
A useful faction-building worksheet.
Combine with [Be a Better Battle Master] to create faction conflicts your players won’t soon forget.




A band of caravan guards, formed from the remnants of a decimated military legion. An organization of archaeologists, dedicated to the reclamation of ancient religious relics before they’re destroyed by a vicious war. A revolutionary group, returned to usurp the greedy politicians who have recently come to power.

Only a master storyteller can weave these factions into a tale for the ages – and that’s where you come in.

Written by Michael Barker of Be a Better Game Master, this supplement offers you, the Game Master, the tools and inspiration needed to introduce fun and realistic factions into your favorite roleplaying game. Inside, you’ll find pages of useful advice, interactive story-building worksheets, and streamlined faction-generators to help you create an endless amount of factions for your world.

Raise your banners – there’s a faction to be built!

188214.name: Be A Better Battle Master
188214.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement includes:

Game-Mastering Advice, Including Four Steps to More Cinematic Battles
33 Sample Battlefield Events for Use in Your Campaign
12 Sample Battlefield Locations to Inspire Your Next Session
Interactive Battle Flowchart
Two Battlefield Maps from Barker’s Homebrew World of Enchea
Additional Tips, Tricks, and Advice from Tabletop Terrors and A Fistful of Dice!
A Companion Instructional Video for Those Who Desire a More Visual Approach




An explosion rocks the castle walls, throwing debris into the air. The gates shatter and split, and the orcish horde spills into the courtyard, falling upon the weary guardsmen and hewing them down like blades of grass. The sun sets as the castle towers burn. Only heroes can turn the tide of this battle – and only the game master can make it real for the players.

Written by Michael Barker of Be a Better Game Master, this supplement gives the game master the tools and inspiration they need to run sweeping, cinematic large-scale battles using their favorite fantasy roleplaying game. Inside you’ll find pages of practical advice, interactive battle-flow worksheets, tide-turning events to make combats feel visceral and dramatic, and plenty of sample battlefields to get those mental gears turning.

Take up arms – there’s a war to be won!

188215.name: Victory's Vault Volume 2, Issue 03
188215.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

The "good" Miss Cindy Wondderra claims to be the keeper of the vaults of a Corporation that deals solely in Victory, and in the pages of Victory's Vault, she offers these items to adventurers and villains alike at remarkable prices! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Miss Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

188216.name: Pirates Dominoes
188216.description:
From the Publisher:

This is a 2 in 1 game. The youngest members of the household may begin playing dominoes with these cool pirate drawings, but can also play the puzzle on the other side. They have to join all the chips together until they end up with a super pirate illustration. And after they are finished playing, they can save it all in its lined cardboard box until the next game.

188217.name: Het Spreekwoorden spel: Deel 2
188217.description:
This is a cardgame where the cards have a drawing on one side, that depicts a Dutch proverb. On the other side the proverb is listed, along with an explanation, example phrases, and a point value. Each turn a player takes one card (with picture visible) and tries to guess the proverb. If possible the explanation can be given. If a player is right, they get the card/points. Whoever has the most points wins.

In 2006 part one appeared.

188221.description:
The Year of the Goat expansion celebrates 20 years of equal opportunity butt-kicking with the Shadowfist card game. Choose one of the game's six factions and have your Secret Warriors battle for control of the world's Feng Shui sites.

This set consists of six 55-card pre-constructed starter decks, one for each of the factions: the Ascended, the Dragons, Eaters of the Lotus, the Guiding Hand, the Jammers, and the Four Monarchs.
188221.name: Shadowfist: Year of the Goat

188225.description:
RONE: Races of New Era is a strategic post-apocalyptic card game for 2 or 4 players. Players are immersed in a dark world full of destruction and suffering, a world where people are fighting to take back their place after a global nuclear war annihilated all achievements of the human race and all that was left was only a handful of usable resources. The remaining scattered groups of survivors are fighting amongst themselves for dominance over the remnants of the past. Now it is your turn to join the global war and recruit soldiers, battle machines, powerful hybrids, or tremendous mutants into your army. Equip your troops with the best available technologies and show all your enemies who is the ruler of the new order.

Players are represented in the game by their hero and play units or one-time effects (tactics) in an attempt to destroy all cards from the opponent’s deck. The number of cards in the deck and the player’s hand is connected to the number of health points of the player's hero. For each point of damage that the hero receives, the player has to destroy one of their cards – from the top of their deck or from their hand. Once a player loses all cards from their deck and hand they lose the game. Because each card used by a player during the game costs them a life point, players are forced to play cards as efficiently as possible so that each played card does more damage to the enemy than to themselves.

These combined mechanics create a well-balanced system where every erroneous move or unplanned action can lead to a player’s defeat. Each and every decision is tightly coupled, and even a small decision can completely change the course of the game.

Players have to find a balance between investing in game control, which allows them to play cards more effectively, or investing in killing the enemy hero, which is the primary goal. This means that players should control their damage output wisely. One can easily feed the enemy graveyard with destroyed cards, which may turn the game completely against them - because of the recycling system which allows players to put cards from the graveyard back on the battlefield. So, instead of dealing massive amounts of damage directly to the enemy hero, waiting sometimes has its benefits.

Timing of attacks, card activation, graveyard management and tactical decisions are the real keys to victory.
188225.name: RONE

188227.name: Pigs In Pants
188227.description: Pigs in Pants is an Educational Take that style matching game. The main aim of the game is to match "pants cards" in your hand with "pants cards" in play. The winner is the player how has the most cards at the end of the game. The pants cards and player boards are very thick card stock more akin to tiles than cards.

188228.description:
Along with the crew of the Dream-chaser, several of Middle-earth's greatest heroes must once more sail the wild seas south of the Grey Havens. Their journey will take them through jagged reefs and raging squalls. They will confront corsairs and risk falling overboard, and all in a desperate effort to reclaim a stolen relic…

Set after the events of The Grey Havens deluxe expansion, Flight of the Stormcaller introduces a new scenario that allows you to embark upon a dramatic, high-stakes chase across the stormy seas. Your heroes join the crew of the Dream-chaser and the other ships in her fleet, and they must battle through treacherous waters, foul weather, and Corsair ships to close upon the Stormcaller, the powerful vessel commanded by the ferocious Captain Sahír. Time is of the essence, and if your heroes can't catch the Stormcaller, they'll forfeit their only link to the forsaken realm of Númenor.

Along with this unique scenario, which features quests decks for the players and for the Corsairs, Flight of the Stormcaller introduces a new Leadership hero and three copies each of ten different player cards. Altogether, its sixty new cards carry us far across uncharted waters, support decks designed to run with fewer than three heroes, reinforce the enduring strengths of the Gondor trait, and boast a handful of unique allies and events that plunge us deep into the cycle's new themes and mechanics.
188228.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Flight of the Stormcaller

77423.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game

boardgamefamily.10452: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

188230.name: Simple Campaigning
188230.description:
48-page A5 full colour booklet containing campaign frameworks for ancient and medieval warfare, which can be played as boardgames or as bases for miniatures battles. Includes Solo Campaigning (the rise of Rome), Angevin Empire, Across the Steppes (Mongol conquests), The Millennium Campaign (11th century Europe), Crisis of Rome (3rd century AD), The Wolf on the Fold (Assyrian Empire), The Calamitous Fourteenth Century (late medieval Europe).

Each of the seven games contains rules for re-creating the conflicts of a historical epoch and region, with counters on a map and using either a combat results table or miniatures. They vary widely in complexity; some have minimal rules and can be played very quickly, while others have detailed political and/or economic rules. The games are designed to entertain both historical boardgamers and miniatures buffs. Several can easily be played solitaire.

The point of each game is to determine by die rolls where conflicts arise, fight the battles and compare the outcome with history. Several include victory point tables so that players can measure their success against each other or, if playing solitaire, against the historical outcome - for example, can the player outdo the Lionheart and King John in holding the Angevin Empire together?

Some of the games can easily be completed in an hour, if using a combat results table; others take considerably longer, while all can last for many sessions if the battles are fought on the tabletop.

188231.description:
Rise of the Gods is an expansion for Tides of Infamy, a mythological universe with a pirate theme.

In Rise of the Gods the Forge of the Gods has been awakened and with it the Ore of the Gods has started to flow. Temples from which the Gods of the Seas derive their power are nearly complete. Help complete construction by offering up the Ore of the Gods as tribute at a Temple of your choice to gain favor among the Sea Gods. Use your otherworldly support to increase your acts of piracy as the most infamous Pirate of the ages.

Rise of the Gods adds the following:

Acts of Piracy (Cards)
Power of the Gods (Cards)
Sea Monster (minifigure)
More Map Tiles
More Pirate Luck Cards
More Pirate Ships - can play up to 6 players (or 8 players with Kickstarter Exclusive edition of Tides of Infamy)




Acts of Piracy are tasks taken on by Pirates that upon successful completion yield Marks of Infamy.

Power Cards are received by paying tribute at a Sea God Temple. They award special abilities to your Pirate Ships.

The Sea Monster roams the board (using the same mechanic as the Ghost Ship in Tides of Infamy) engaging in battles.
188231.name: Rise of the Gods: Tides of Infamy Expansion

188232.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 14 - Fall 2015)
188232.description:
From publisher's website:

Well, it's a bit later than it should have been but school and family issues threw a wrench in the works last month. However, the hurdles were overcome and here is issue 14 of the Frontier Explorer.

This issue contains all the usual entries from equipment to spaceships to races to creatures to stories. It also branches out a bit in that one of the ships presented is primarily designed for Starships & Spacemen 2ed but has a Star Frontiers conversion. In addition, we have some articles by a couple of new authors including one of our Patreon supporters, Scott Holliday.

The contents of this issue are:

The Space Clans
My Friend Jurak and Fat Max
The Artificers
The Opening Act
Ion Engines of the Frontier
Remus Shuttle & Romulus Runabout
Scarecrow Bot
Limp Softly Carrying a Big Stick
Titian Rising: 2299 Comic
Got Gas Giants?
The Astral Horizon
Creature Conversions
Paxac the Puncher
A Wedding Tale
Grimz Guide Comic

So grab your copy and dive in. And always remember to keep exploring.

188233.name: Tipping Point
188233.description:
Have we found your Tipping Point? The high stakes quiz game the whole family can enjoy. Based on the highly popular TV game show, Tipping Point combines general knowledge questions and answers with nail-biting unpredictability.

Compete as teams or individuals. By answering questions correctly, players win tokens to drop into the electronic table top tipping point machine. Which of the four drop zone do you think will give you the biggest payout?

As the machine slides back and fourth, let your token fall and see whether that will start a chain reaction. One single correct answer could trigger a cashcade that changes everything!

Which team can amass the most counters to go forward and compete in the final jackpot round?

The show presented by Ben Shephard originally aired on ITV1 from 2012 until 2014 then on ITV since 2015.

188234.name: Orbit (2015)
188234.description:
User Summary

You are a comet going through space. You seek to orbit planets without crashing, flying off into space, or losing your physical integrity. Each manual move (not using the planet's natural gravity) erodes some of your material, so you must plan ahead to use other gravity-based objects or special space conditions.

188235.name: Hide and Seek Audio: The Friendly Farm
188235.description:
The new Hide and Seek Audio excites the senses for a stimulating game of discovery.

Two ways to play:
Conventional game: The game comes with several boards, each depicting a scene scattered with various different objects. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot. One of the boards is chosen for the game.

On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulates the most cards.

With the DVD: Be the first (or play as a group) to find the animals and other things that correspond to the 30 sounds on the DVD.

188239.name: South Park (Buzz Monkey)
188239.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Buzz Monkey Software started making a South Park game that never finished development. Footage from an recently discovered Xbox development kit was later made available to the public. Marshall Gause stated that a few months into the game’s development cycle. He was helping to reboot the troubled and “overly ambitious” project, but just three weeks after Gause started work on South Park, its development stopped forever.

188240.name: KOEkeloeren
188240.description:
The following is a rough translation from the Dutch manual. Some terms just cannot be translated without loss of meaning, sorry about that.

KOEkeloeren is a Moohingly exciting (LOEIspanned) cardgame. Play along with Kittie Cow, Pleuntje kitten, Mistie mouse, Pepper pup, Gagger goat and Bibi piglet.
To help the play KOEkeloeren right, they have put on their glasses.

Contents:
72 playing cards (2*6 cards for each animal)
8 combination cards (showing how to score)
2 dice

Strictly, the box "contains" 5 games, that all use the cards in the box.
These five games are: KOEkeloeren [a8; p3-6], GABBERen [a5; p2-6], BIGgen ("pigletting") [a5; p3-6], Doe de PEPPER (Do the PEPPER) [a4; [3-6] en Pleuntjes Bluf! [a5; p2-6].
Per game, the minimum age and number of players variate slightly, I have added in square brackets after the name of the game, e.g.: [a5; p2-4] would mean ages 5 and up, number of players 2 through 4. Playing time also differences per game.

The manual and 8 combination cards are in Dutch, the playing card are language neutral.

188241.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 70 - June 1981)
188241.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 70
June 1981

Published as PDF in 2015

Issue 70 credited Phil Alexander as the cover artist; Issue 71 had a corrigendum which noted that Phil Galloway was the actual artist.

188242.name: Oceanheart
188242.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Oceanheart is a boat-based exploration game that combines elements from Wind Waker, Animal Crossing and Harvest Moon. We’re aiming for a chill and playful experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

188244.name: One Way to Die
188244.description:
User Summary

In this text adventure, you die a lot, usually on the first or second or third move. There are many different ways to die, many highly unlikely and unavoidable no matter what choice is made. There are some immunities to be gained by some choices but it's always a strong possibility that those won't help you. If you keep persisting in playing over and over again eventually you will succeed. The game takes less than 15 minutes to complete. Usually.

188245.name: Sharknado: The Playset
188245.description:
From publisher:

My God, It's Full Of Sharks!

This shouldn't be happening. A Sharknado defies all science, logic, rhyme and reason, but the sharks don't seem to care much about that. You don't have time to care much about that either. Storm clouds are gathering. The sharks are coming. What are you going to do about it?

188246.name: Forge of the Armies
188246.description:
From the introduction:

Forge of the Armies is a 8th to 10th level adventure designed for the dungeons and dragons open gaming license D20 series 3.5 system. It is easily used with a number of different gaming systems with limited modifications to the creatures or the settings. The adventure takes place on the world of Centrifuge and this can easily be modified to take place on the peripheral of any major kingdom. The adventure is designed to be the third in the Revenge of the Dracolich series but can also stand apart as a singular adventure. A Lawful Good cleric is highly recommended but this portion can be edited to any good cleric.

188247.name: Temple of the Forgotten God
188247.description:
From the introduction:

Down on your luck you’re offered a simple task of guarding a contingent of clerics on a holy visit to an archaeological site for research. What begins as a change to recoup your losses and regain your strength soon becomes an exercise to outwit and survive the challenges of the Temple of the Forgotten God.

Temple of the Forgotten God is a Dungeon and Dragons 3.5 adventure suitable for four – 5th level characters. The adventure is easily modified for both higher-level characters or different game systems with some minor modifications.

It is recommended that no character with flight ability (magical or non-magical) be in the party. The party must start with less than 5 G.P in coin and or viable treasure.

188248.name: Twilight Citadel
188248.description:
From the introduction:

Two generations past a Paladin order of the God Tyr used the Twilight Citadel as a stronghold, which dominated the local trade route between the nations of Highwood and Stonewater. The two nations had always been rivals but were on relatively friendly terms joined in their common belief of Tyr. This was rent asunder when a new Lawful Good holy order, that of Athena came to the area and swiftly begun to convert the local population of Highwood to its side. This eventually led to a religious civil war in the region and the eventual separation of the lands into two camps of belief.

Geographically the two nations have been set apart by the Needle mountains an offshoot of the greater Spiral Peaks mountain chain. With only a few sparse trade routes thru them and no discernible passage otherwise, the few trade routes that did exist were important to both nations. Thus the Twilight citadel that sat upon a lone hill within a valley acted not only as a trade route monitor but also as the faiths headquarters in the region.

The civil war that swept the land some fifty years ago lead to the Citadel of the Tyrians being eventually besieged, breached and all therein slain. Once conquered the citadel quickly fell into disuse as the Athenians moved on in their solidification of their dominance of the faith of Highwood. Unfortunately one of the slain men of Tyr refused to take his journey to the afterlife and becoming consumed by the desire for revenge began to bring his hatred to bear on all those he considered as his enemy.

188249.name: Noteworthy Fey
188249.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 creatures: Gremlin (Jinkin), Mite, Nymph, Quickling, Redcap

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

188250.name: Exotic Aberrations
188250.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 creatures: Choker, Eye of the Deep, Froghemoth, Gug, and Neothelid

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

188251.name: The Cairn of Recall
188251.description:
From the introduction:

The Cairn of Recall is a 5th to 7th level adventure designed for the Dungeons and Dragons Open Gaming License D20 series 3.5 system. It is easily modified to be used with a number of different gaming systems with limited modifications to the creatures or the settings. The adventure takes place on the world of Centrifuge and this can easily be modified to take place on the peripheral of any major kingdom. The adventure is designed to compliment but stand apart from the greater adventure series Revenge of the Dracolich.

188252.name: Tower of Boon Companions
188252.description:
From publisher blurb:

WhiteBox One-Shots is a line of short wilderness side treks, dungeon delves, and other brief encounters designed for compatibility with the Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox roleplaying game.

A tribe of orcs has moved into a ruined tower and begun raiding local villages. On its surface, it seems like a simple problem that any band of stalwart adventurers could handle. However, the tower was once an Adventurer's Guild outpost and is said to be haunted by the souls of fallen adventurers. Rumors also persist of long-forgotten treasures just waiting to be reclaimed. Can the party drive off the orcs and uncover the mystery of the Tower of Boon Companions?

The Tower of Boon Companions is a Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox adventure designed for 3-6 characters of 3rd-5th level (about 18 levels total). It is a site-based dungeon crawl with a number of different threats and challenges (some of which are class-based), so a variety of classes is recommended. Although vague references are made to the Chronicles of Amherth campaign setting, the adventure is designed to be dropped into any OSR campaign world.

188253.description:
The Red Dragon Inn Organized Play Participation Promo card. This card is given away if you win an RDI organized play.

Begin a Round of Gambling as though you just played "Gambling? I'm in!"

The winter of that Round of Gambling gains 2 alcohol Content.

Players may Ignore this Event to avoid the Round of Gambling. (However, players may no longer do this once the Round has begun.)

The best gamblers know when to stop!
188253.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Compulsive Gambler's Grog

188254.name: One Final Breath
188254.description:
User Summary

Done in first person, you search through a hospital looking for your daughter, but end up searching for keys.

188255.name: First Blood
188255.description:
User summary:

First Blood uses numerous elements of tabletop role-playing that will be familiar to experienced gamers. Actions involve rolling 2D6 and adding a modifier and then comparing the result to a Target Number, ranging from 2 (Automatic) through 8 (Serious) to 20 (Nearly Impossible). Resisted actions utilize an opponent roll in place of the Target Number. Combat uses initiative and other more involved mechanisms.

Characters have Body Attributes (Strength, Speed, and Dexterity) and Mind Attributes (Intelligence, Wits, and Charisma. Characters also have a variety of Skills. Most aspects of character generation can be either randomized or selected.

188256.name: OASE:  Other Age Single Encounter
188256.description:
User Summary

More visual novel and graphics, this game centers on creating a romantic persona and dating a girl. There are puzzles and adventure but mostly it involves reading dialogue.

188257.name: Adventures in Fenestra
188257.description:
From the introduction:

Ahead of you are moral tales, a slew of new beasts and the briefest possible overview of Fenestra – just enough to start to move about in the world and describe it. The order of the sections are unimportant, so if you want more detail, skip imediately to the appendices at the back for a look at the mythology and cosmology in play. If you're really just looking for a few monsters to drop into your own stories, jump to the bestiary.

188259.name: Utah Geek Magazine (Issue 8 - Nov/Dec 2015)
188259.description:
Utah Geek Magazine
Issue 8
November/December 2015

The PDF Version was published with two covers, a "standard" cover and an "alternate/dark side" cover. Contents of both versions are otherwise identical.

Star Wars - Past, Present, Future
Utah's Indie Game Developers

188260.name: StarCraft: Ghost

videogamehonor.31749: 2003 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

188260.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




StarCraft: Ghost is a cancelled game previously under development by Blizzard Entertainment. Part of Blizzard's StarCraft series, the game was announced on September 20, 2002, and was to be developed by Nihilistic Software for the Nintendo GameCube, Xbox, and PlayStation 2 video game consoles. Several delays in development caused Blizzard to move back the release date and the game has not yet materialized. Nihilistic Software ceded development to Swingin' Ape Studios in 2004 before Blizzard bought the company, and plans for the GameCube version were cancelled in 2005.

Blizzard announced in March 2006 that the game was put on "indefinite hold" while the company investigated seventh generation video game console possibilities. The continued delay of Ghost had caused it to be labeled as vaporware, and it was ranked fifth in Wired News‍ '​ annual Vaporware Awards in 2005. In 2014, Blizzard president Mike Morhaime confirmed that Ghost was officially cancelled.

Unlike its real-time strategy predecessor StarCraft, Ghost is a third-person shooter, and was intended to give players a closer and more personal view of the StarCraft universe. Following Nova, a Terran psychic espionage operative called a "ghost", the game is set four years after the conclusion of StarCraft: Brood War and covers a conspiracy about a secretive military project conducted by Nova's superiors in the imperial Terran Dominion. Very little of the game's storyline has been released; however, in November 2006 after the game's postponement, a novel was published called StarCraft Ghost: Nova, which covers the backstory of the central character.

Source: Wikipedia, "StarCraft: Ghost", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188261.name: Pizzeria Allegro
188261.description:
A tasty fun play set for 1-4 pizza bakers

This pizza bake sets contains two games.
Pizza presto:
A red hot pizza duel for two children, flip a card the first kid take puts the right toppings on the pizza and puts their pizza in the oven wins the card. Best of 9.

One Pizza Margarita, please!
A crunchy listen-well game for 1-4 pizza bakers and an adult

On a little bakers turn the adult reads the ingredients on the card, if the pizza has the correct ingredients the little pizza baker gets the card. Most cards wins.

188262.name: SingStar Mecano
188262.description:
User Summary
SingStar Mecano follows the traditional formula of the SingStar saga, with all songs belonging to the Spanish pop band Mecano. It was only released in Spain. The songs included are:

PS2 & PS3
Aire
Ay qué pesado
Bailando salsa
Barco a Venus
Cruz de navajas
El 7 de Septiembre
El blues del esclavo (versión tango)
El fallo positivo
Quédate en Madrid
Hawaii-Bombay
Hijo de la Luna
Hoy no me puedo levantar
J.C.
La fuerza del destino
Laika
Los amantes
Maquillaje
Me colé en una fiesta
Me cuesta tanto olvidarte
Mujer contra mujer
Naturaleza nuerta
No es serio este cementerio
No hay marcha en Nueva York
Perdido en mi habitación
Una rosa es una rosa
Ya viene el Sol

PS3 exclusives
Eungenio Salvador Dalí
Héroes de la Antártida
Japón

188264.name: SingStar Clásicos
188264.description:
User Summary
SingStar Clásicos is a Spain-exclusive SingStar title, which includes Spanish hits from the 60's, 70's and 80's. The songs included are:

Al Bano & Romina Power, "Felicidad"
Ana Belén y Víctor Manuel, "La Puerta de Alcalá"
Baccara, "Sorry, I'm a Lady"
Cecilia, "Dama, dama"
Danny Daniel, "Por El Amor de una Mujer"
Dúo Dinámico, "Quisiera Ser"
El Fary, "El Toro Guapo"
Fórmula V, "Cuéntame"
Fórmula V, "Eva María"
Francisco, "Latino"
Isabel Pantoja, "Marinero de Luces"
Jeanette, "Soy rebelde"
José Luis Perales, "Un velero llamado Libertad"
Karina, "El Baúl de los Recuerdos"
Karina, "Las Flechas del Amor"
Lola Flores, "Pena, Penita, Pena"
Los Bravos, "Black is Black"
Los Chunguitos, "Ay Que Dolor"
Los Payos, "María Isabel"
Manolo Escobar, "Mi carro"
Massiel, "La, La, La"
Miguel Ríos, "Santa Lucía"
Mocedades, "Eres tú"
Módulos, "Todo Tiene Su Fin"
Nino Bravo, "Te Quiero, Te Quiero"
Paloma San Basilio, "Juntos"
Pimpinela, "Olvídame y Pega La Vuelta"
Raffaella Carrá, "Qué Dolor"
Rocío Jurado, "Como Una Ola"
Rocío Dúrcal, "Me gustas mucho"

188265.name: SingStar La Edad de Oro del Pop Español
188265.description:
User Summary
"La Edad de Oro del Pop Español" was the first Spain-exclusive SingStar title. Its track list is composed of Spanish pop hits of the 80's. The songs included are:

Aerolíneas Federales, "No Me Beses En Los Labios"
Alaska y Dinarama, "A quién le importa"
Alaska y Los Pegamoides, "Bailando"
Antonio Flores, "No Dudaría"
Burning, "¿Qué Hace Una Chica Como Tu En Un Sitio Como Este?"
Danza Invisible, "Sabor de amor"
Dinamita Pa' Los Pollos, "Purita Dinamita"
Duncan Dhu, "Cien gaviotas"
Ejecutivos Agresivos, "Mari Pili"
Gabinete Caligari, "Al calor del amor en un bar"
Hombres G, "Devuelveme a mi Chica"
La Frontera, "El Límite"
La Guardia, "Cuando brille el sol"
Loquillo Y Trogloditas, "El Rompeolas"
Los Nikis, "El imperio contraataca"
Los Rebeldes, "Mediterráneo"
Los Romeos, "Mi Vida Rosa"
Los Ronaldos, "Adiós Papá"
Los Secretos, "Déjame"
Mecano, "Un año más"
Modestia Aparte, "Es Por Tu Amor"
Nacha Pop, "Vístete"
Olé Olé, "No Controles"
Polansky Y El Ardor, "Ataque Preventivo de la URSS"
Rosendo, "Loco Por Incordiar"
Tam Tam Go!, "Manuel Raquel"
The Refrescos, "Aquí no hay playa"
Tino Casal, "Embrujada"
Los Toreros Muertos, "Mi Agüita Amarilla"
Los Zombies, "Groenlandia"

188266.name: Evil Clerics
188266.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let the Blasphemous Rite Begin!

Legendary Villains: Evil Clerics delves deeply into the lore and legendarium of the most devoted servants of the dark powers: evil clerics. Though not always a GM’s go-to villain, these malevolent mendicants and blasphemous bishops are plentiful in fantasy games. Myriad options in the form of archetypes and domains already exist, but this book goes further in exploring the roles evil clerics can play as villains in a campaign. This book includes dozens of new feats, spells, and archetypes specially designed for evil clerics, as well as the disease domain and sinweaver prestige class, providing a wealth of options for augmenting existing cleric class features. In addition, it provides all-new options like the avatar of evil family of feats that bring an evil cleric one step closer to dreadful divinity, variant channeling feats to enrich an evil cleric's bag of supernatural tricks, and the Craft Cursed Item feat gives mischievous clerics a new way to torment their victims. Finally, this book contains a collection of malicious magic items like the altar of binding and phylactery of heresy, some to augment the armamentarium of an evil apostle and others to bedevil those who would stand in her way, along with a pair of perilous priestly tomes replete with dark secrets, sinister spells, and other nefarious new options to make your cultists and clerics truly memorable foes.

Grab this 40-page testament to the power of the dark side of divinity, and as if evil clerics weren't enough you can make your most malevolent masters of evil even more marvelous with the companion books Legendary Villains: Antipaladins and Legendary Villains: Dark Druids! It's time to Make Your Villains Legendary!

188267.name: Mythic Erinyes and Horned Devils
188267.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Worst Hell Has To Offer!

The erinyes and the horned devil are perhaps the most terrifying and iconic devils, representing both the fallen angel, in the form of the cruel and torturous erinyes, and the classic devilish imagery of a bat-winged, horned, oversized muscular humanoid, in the form of the chained devil. Despite this, neither of these two great infernal warriors received any mythic treatment in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures.

This book presents game statistics for the mythic erinyes (CR 10), which projects an aura of truth that painfully punishes all those who lie within its presence, can keep victims alive long after they should be dead, and can even torture a creature so thoroughly that if it returns to life after being killed by the mythic erinyes, it does her bidding. It also presents statistics for the mythic horned devil (CR 20). These fiends can wrap their spiked chains around a victim’s throat, using the chain like a leash to magically control their victim. Their chain can also rend a victim’s very soul, along with its body, and much, much more. Finally, the book includes detailed summoning rituals that allow characters of any class to summon mythic erinyes and mythic horned devils, at their own peril.

188268.name: Advanced Bloodrager Bloodlines
188268.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloodragers want to play, too! This book adapts the sorcerer bloodlines from the Advanced Player Guide and Ultimate Magic to bloodrager bloodlines. The included bloodlines are:

Accursed, Aquatic, Boreal, Deep Earth, Djinni, Dreamspun, Efreeti, Maestro, Marid, Protean, Rakshasa, Serpentine, Shadow, Shaitan, Starsoul, Stormborn, Verdant

188269.name: Metal Heroes
188269.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eight Heroes Ready to Battle through Savage Science to the Stars!

Metal Heroes is our sixth set of 8 ready-to-play pregenerated 1st level characters created specifically to shine in a Metal Gods Adventure Path but ideal for any campaign venturing into the marvelous mash-up of the fantastical and the futuristic! Ideal for use as allies, cohorts, long-running NPCs, or replacement player characters, superstar author Neil Spicer brings you amazingly detailed and lushly developed characters including:

Ander Six, android slayer
Bersaivius Mendren, human blood arcanist growing his own tumor familiar
Drunah Dagur, human bloodrager
Falston Katcherby, gnome preservationist alchemist
Tavarest Ivaine, oread cleric of the Goddess of Invention
Kheldric Lybrien, human steel hound investigator
Lyel Vergess, human pistolero gunslinger
and last but not least, the clever and conniving Rikka Nufhari, ratfolk burglar!




Built according to organized play specifications, using the 20-point-buy method and with scaling notes for 15-point builds, these characters are not just piles of statistics. Each one is as much about story as combat, with robust links built in to each other as well as the official Metal Gods Adventure Path, though every one easily stands on its own in any setting where savage barbarians battle technological terrors. The crunch for every character more than measures up to its incredible flavor text, though, and when it’s time to throw down in combat none of these Metal Heroes will be stepping to the sidelines.

Each character includes a detailed backstory, roleplaying tips, special equipment, and links to the published campaign, including a campaign trait selection from the Pirate Adventure Path player’s guide. Each also lists detailed level advancement information for their first few levels, with further suggestions for developing the character's long-term mechanical build. We haven't even mentioned the fantastic character portraits courtesy of Bob Greyvenstein, or the included foldable paper miniatures for every character!

If you are looking for terrific characters where sci-fi meets fantasy, download this 42-page product today and Make Your Game Legendary!

188270.name: Treasury of the Machine
188270.description:
From publisher blurb:

These Treasures are Totally Metal!

The Treasury of the Machine brings you an awesome array of technological and technomagical tools to enhance your Pathfinder campaign! Whether your heroes are questing against an entire nation of renegade super-scientists and alien horrors, or you just want to inject a touch of science fiction into your fantasy, the Treasury of the Machine delivers in spades with over 60 technological items of every description, from devastating weapons like the rapture ray, targeting computer, gravity cannon, kinesis grappler, or singularity grenade, to awesome accessories like the learning helmet, targeting computer, slipsuit, and ghosting unit. This book contains items as helpful as the neutralizing safety blanket and solar array and items as sinister as the memory transfer probe and amnesia tick, and range in power from simple disposable items to the artifact robot control harness. You'll find entirely new categories of cybernetics and pharmaceuticals like biotech and chemosols, weapon accessories, special materials, android modifications, and even a new robotic pet, the walking eye! If it's majestic mechanical and magical treasures that delight and excite, your PCs will love what they find in the Treasury of the Machine.

If you are looking for terrific characters where sci-fi meets fantasy, get this 28-page product today and Make Your Game Legendary!

188271.name: Starfall
188271.description:
From publisher blurb:

It Came from Beyond the Stars!

What begins as a simple rescue mission takes a turn for the surreal when the heroes are abducted by a great silvery egg that whisks them into the stars. Finding themselves aboard a crippled star-faring vessel, long stranded in orbit around the their homeworld, the heroes encounter an enigmatic race of human starfarers, prisoners aboard their own ship by alien foes that threaten their survival even as they menace the heroes' own world. Seeking these alien enemies through tunnels of steel and corridors crackling with energy, the heroes must brave an artificial jungle stocked with fearsome flora and fauna to reach the long-abandoned bowels of the ancient ship, only to come face-to-face with an alien threat of unimaginable horror … an alien threat that has just initiated the ship’s self-destruct sequence!

Starfall is a massive 76-page Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 13th-level characters that merges sorcery and spacecraft, blending magic and machines with a touch of cosmic horror to create an harrowing journey into danger that is literally out of this world. This adventure can be played on its own or as an accessory to the Metal Gods Adventure Path. Like every product from Legendary Games, it brings together the talents of the top authors and artists in the business to bring you a fantastic play experience at the table and a product that is as pleasurable to read as it is to use. When you combine innovative layout, beautiful aesthetics, and excellence in design that is second to none, that is when you Make Your Game Legendary!

188273.name: Martial Arts Guidebook
188273.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hey, you! Yeah, you with the swords!

You asked for nice things, and we listened...

Like a lovingly forged and carefully honed weapon, the Martial Arts Guidebook offers you the chance to employ 59 new martial arts-themed Techniques: methods for your characters to do something more on the battlefield. It also explores the use of arcane, ki, and grit points to perform awesome martial arts techniques.
