In addition, it brings you six detailed martial schools, complete with descriptions, adventure seeds, boons and associated NPCs – almost twenty personalities to fill out the ranks, along with new feats and new magical items, all with a combat bent.

Why should rogues and wizards get all the fun? This is about giving your game not only a lot of options for the battlefield, but creating martial organizations for your game world. You don’t have to just be former member of the guard or a retired military man, or a mercenary without a company. You can be part of a subcultures of warriors who band together in schools for exotic reasons and pursue evocative goals.

Crafted by the dedicated collective of Timothy Wallace, Matthew Stinson, William Senn, Mike Wice, Aaron Phelps and ENnie-award winner Ben McFarland, the Martial Arts Guidebook gives you something to strive towards, something to fight for, and a stylish sense of cinematic panache while you're at it.

188274.name: Knetivity: Der kreative Partyspaß
188274.description:
Party game for 2 to 6 Players.

The players get task cards which give them tasks which they have to solve with knead.
There are different kind of cards.

creating special objects
building in duel with another player (first wins)
all build the same in a sandglass time
building a little game, e.g. a bowling game and every player can try to hit all pins (with 3 ball throws).




The player who gets first 20 points wins the game.

27490.name: WOW! What a World of Entertainment AB

188276.description:
The players are children that have sneaked in to the castle of count Dracula. To get out they have to find a torch and key. About all avoid to get bite by the count.

Every player roll first and move their piece and after roll and move count Dracula towards the other players pieces. If count Dracula lands on same space as an players piece that player get bite and become a vampire and after that start to hunt the other players.

You win either if you are the first player escaping or manage to bite the last player.
188276.name: Vampyrjakten

188277.name: Marble Mayhem:  Fragile Ball
188277.description:
User Summary

You rotate the game board to make the marble roll towards the opening at the other side of the game. The extra trick is that if the marble makes too fast a descent, it shatters. There are a variety of mazes; the music is simple and the graphics basic.

188278.name: Artefakt (Issue 15 - 2005)
188278.description:
German Fanzine featuring adventures for the following RPG systems:

- Arcane Codex (Das Böse über der Stadt)
- Call of Cthulhu (Le Tour de mal - 1903)
- Kleine Ängste (Die Weiße Frau)

Also contains a large review of Lovecraft inspired movies.

188279.name: Artefakt (Issue 7 - 2001)
188279.description:
Featuring adventures for the following RPG systems:

- World of Darkness/Vampire: The Masquerade (The Grinning Wolf)
- Call of Cthulhu (Das Leben ist eine Kopeke)
- Vampire: The Masquerade (Im Auftrag des Herrn)

background articles for Shadowrun and Call of Cthulhu and a Battletech timeline.

188280.name: Artefakt (Issue 10 - 2002)
188280.description:
Containing adventures of the following RPG systems:

- Call of Cthulhu (Der Sandmann)
- Legends of the Five Rings (Falsche Freunde, falsche Feinde)
- Deadlands: Weird West (Event Tequila & Los Paranoias)
- Werewolf: Dark Ages (Schneegestöber)

and a background for Vampire: Dark Ages - furthermore plenty of reviews.

188281.name: Artefakt (Issue 11 - 2003)
188281.description:
Containing adventures of the following RPG systems:

- KULT (Die Bücher des Alten)
- Fading Suns (Das Auge Gottes)
- Shadowrun (Sagenhaftes Coburg + Shopping Run)

and background articles for Call of Cthulhu and Vampire: Dark Ages.

188282.name: Artefakt (Issue 12 - 2003)
188282.description:
Containing adventures of the following systems:

- Call of Cthulhu (Spurensuche)
- Deadlands: Weird West (Familienangelegenheiten)
- Legend of the 7th sea / GURPS (Angelis Liste)

and a background article for Vampire: Dark Ages.

188283.name: Deutschlands Häfen u. Küsten: Ein Reisespiel
188283.description:
The players start at space 1 (Borkum) and have to reach space 50 (after Königsberg). Movement is determined by one die. On some spaces the players are hindered or benefited by certain events. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

The game is played with nice pewter ships and was most likely published before WWI.

188284.name: Artefakt (Issue 14 - 2004)
188284.description:
Containing adventures for the following RPG systems:

- Fading Suns (Schatzjagd)
- Deadlands: Weird West (Tequila-Quest)
- Call of Cthulhu (by gaslight) (Götterdämmerung)

and background articles about horror audio books and music you can use during your horror-related RPG sessions.

188285.name: Book One: Rolecraft
188285.description:
The Ysgarth System
5th Edition
Book 1 - Rolecraft

From the introduction:

[This] first book contains all of the hard rules for character creation, combat and skill use.

188286.name: Book Two: Spellcraft
188286.description:
The Ysgarth System
5th Edition
Book 2 - Spellcraft

From the introduction:

[This] second book goes into detail on magic and religion, with spells, powers and mechanical systems.

188287.name: Book Three: Worldcraft
188287.description:
The Ysgarth System
5th Edition
Book 3 - Worldcraft

From the introduction:

[This] third book goes into detail on background design and applications of the rules in the society of the world of Ysgarth from which the game takes its name.

188288.name: Johnsonville: Cutthroat Capitalism
188288.description:
Referred to by the publishers as a "role-playing party game", Johnsonville: Cutthroat Capitalism is a dice-rolling thematic game set in a small 1950s town.

Players start with a small pool of money that may be depleted every turn, and the object of the game is to have completed the most "citizenly tasks" (objectives drawn at the start of the game) by the time all other players have lost money. Player interference to deplete the money of other players is encouraged.

Actions in the game can be completed in two ways- through rolling against the Game Master, or "Johnson", or by drawing "Kit Cards", fictional cure-all products. Players interact by describing actions and rolling or drawing to attempt to complete them. The positive(or negative) effects of these attempts are described by the Johnson in a humorous fashion based on the numbers rolled or card drawn.

188289.name: Louie Cooks
188289.description:
Your cat Louie is one of a kind: He wants to become a marmalade-cook and expects your help protecting his fruity ingredients from the onmarching waves of cuties!

Each type of cutie has their own weakness which you need to make us of! Shake your head, stare at them, sing/whistle or make a loud noise to keep Louie cooking! We also feature complete Oculus Rift compatibility for your adventure!

Try to break through multiple waves and score cat-triple points with huge combo-chains! If you're not sure if you want to shout 'n sing just yet, simply turn off the audio-option! The "Quick Game"-mode allows you to fully customize your experience or master the challenges in the story mode and follow Louie's path on becoming a master cook!

Source: The Game Website.

188292.name: Ten
188292.description:
The number 10 is the focus of the game. To score ten, each player has a beautiful set of wooden tiles scoring values from 1 to 3.
The players take alternate turns to place their tiles in the game field. The rows become longer and grow in all directions. Who will be the first player to create a series of personal tiles to score a total of 10?
TEN is a simple, but strategic connection game when players must constantly keep an eye on the opponent’s row of tiles.
Seeing the bigger picture, risk-taking and a little luck are needed to score 10. There are two versions of the rules, so players can test their luck a little more or less.

188293.name: Bitwy Okretow
188293.description:
Bitwy Okretow (War of Ships) is a quick, easy wargame about batlles fought between XVII-XVIII century ships. Players may choose and customize their fleets, creating big number of small ships or small number of the bigger ones. Rules contains maneuvers, wind dependency, boarding and burning enemy ships.

Game was published in the 40 issue of "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine in both Polish and English editions.

188294.name: Crecy 1346
188294.description:
Crecy 1346 is a game about most famous battle of the 100 years war fought between Kingdom of England and Kingdom of France. The battle was fought on 26 August 1346 near Crécy in northern France and was the major victory of the English army under the king Edward III.

Game was published in the 40 issue of Taktyka i Strategia magazine, in both Polish and English versions. Is uses Medieval (Sredniowiecze) games mechanic.

188295.name: Labyronia RPG
188295.description:
Synopsis

Labyronia is a traditional, story-driven RPG focused on partly non-linear progression and exploration in a large and original world. Advancing in the world and puzzle solving requires critical thinking at times, even though most puzzles and environmental hazards are fairly simple to overcome. The game's core challenges lie in overcoming certain large rough road maps, and surviving the strategic boss battles on the way. To gain more skills, the player must utilize the super-simple, but elegant Cue system. The storyline starts slowly, but should be emotion-inducing.

A brief introduction

The Labyrinths. Maze-like structures consisting of trees, rocks, hills and everything in nature. The Four Elemental Gods- Labyronia's rulers- created the Labyrinths by using their divine might. Soon afterwards, powerful monsters appeared, beginning to cause havoc in the world.

Fifty years have passed since the Labyrinths first came to be. Why were they created? Did the gods really want to punish the people for their wickedness? What about those monsters? They seem to have originated after the

Labyrinths appeared. It's time to stop pondering this and go out there to find out the truth myself! This will be the final chapter of my diary, at least for now.

-Diary of Arres

Features & Version Info

-Partly non-linear progression in a large and original world.

-The Cue system encourages exploration. Find abnormalities to obtain skills, and challenge yourself to collect all the Cues!

-Strategic Boss battles, and smooth combat system with Yanfly's battle engine.

-Random battles are limited to the world map (and even there it's possible to avoid them usually.) Otherwise, all enemies are visible.

-Clean, colorful visuals and a bunch of fresh-looking monsters.

-Experience the emotional storyline and challenge the four elemental gods!

Source: The Developer Website.

188296.name: Labyronia RPG 2
188296.description:
Synopsis

Labyronia 2 is a traditional, story-driven RPG, mainly focused on a strong atmosphere. The story takes place in a dark, icy fantasy world, and contains horror elements.
The progression through the maps and objectives is mostly linear, but optional secrets are hidden in certain maps. Advancing and puzzle solving may require critical thinking at times.
The game has a simple turn-based battle system, and a skill-collecting system via Arms Manuals and Spellbooks. These items can be found from the secret areas of the game, or bought from certain stores. Playing the first Labyronia is not required to understand Labyronia 2, since the overaching storyline can be obtained through the course of the game.

Story

10 years have passed since the hero of Labyronia fulfilled the Dark Prophecy.

Labyronia, a warring world once ruled by four gods of the four elements. To gain absolute power over the unruly nations, the four gods used their might to create the Labyrinths: maze-like structures formed from bits of surrounding nature. To achieve this, they used a magical item called the Pendant of Labyronia, which was said to be of divine origin.
After the people had spent a few years getting lost in the messed up new world, a bunch of monsters appeared. Without further ado, they started to wreck every place (no questions asked) including the capital of the world and the place where those gods were hanging out!
Unfortunately the gods had a plan to counter these monsters, and of course they had to go and execute it. This is where things got even worse. It's all got to do with this guy called Arres, and how we gave a good beating to both the monsters and those smug gods! This led to an event followed by the state we're now in...

The world has gone cold, and dark. Seriously, there's no clear spot up on the sky from the clouds. I need to scrape frost from my whiskers every morning! Additionally, there are freaking ghosts out there, trying to kill everyone not looking at race or gender. Believe me, you do not want to stick with these guys... 'cause they are gonna stick on you! If we can't resolve this situation with haste, i'm a bit worried that this world might experience the opposite of "heat death", and it ain't gonna take long! So, it's time to start doing something about it.
First, I need to go see Windir. He used to be a god after all...

-Garic's diary, final page

Features

-Discover the hugely atmospheric world of Labyronia during its final days.

-Learn new skills by reading Arms Manuals and Spellbooks. Explore the world to find hidden skills!

-Yanfly's Visual Battler system provides enjoyable combat.

-Recolored and revamped tilesets and graphics to offer an original look.

-Solve puzzles and overcome environmental hazards ranging from easy to demanding.

-Experience the dark and emotional storyline in a world of fantasy and horror.

Source: The Developer Website.

188297.name: Legend of Mysteria RPG
188297.description:
Game Manual

In the ancient tower of Mysteria, wizards ruled the world of Labyronia. The first leader of the Order, Zemocon, had pioneered gaining divine powers. According to old prophecies, one day four gods would reign equally, governing the four elements.

Something in Labyronia was however changing. It was first noticed by the Council of the highest ranking wizards. A strange malice was spreading in the world, and rumors of war emerged. The wizards felt powerless, deciding to hold a meeting to address the situation.

And so, the wizards gathered in the great Assembly Hall. Red robed mages of fire, blue robed mages of water, brown and green-garbed earth mages and air mages in purple cloaks stepped into the hall each one in their turn, to face the Head of the Council, Dinyon. Suddenly, something unforeseen happened.

An assassin shot an arrow, and it pierced Dinyon. "I'm... bleeding", the great wizard muttered. Before the members of the Council were able to react, Dinyon suddenly vanished in a bright flash of light.
The assassin attempted to flee, but one of the wizards struck him down with a fireball. It appeared that the offender was not a wizard, but a normal human. Someone had hired him and brought him into the tower.
The red robed wizard grabbed the assassin, asking: "Who hired you?!" Drawing his last breath, the murderer whispered a name: Windir. Perplexed, the young air mage Windir tried to defend himself against this false accusation, but to no avail.

In the Assembly Hall, three of the most powerful wizards from each element were present at the time of the assassination. Who is the real perpetrator?

- The origin story to Labyronia Saga.

- Immerse yourself in the unprecedented gameplay: discover clues and information to unveil the secrets of the Wizard's Council.

- Nonlinear progression with mysterious puzzles and riddles: Your best weapon is your intelligence.

- Unusually dense world, with a great amount of things to do in every area.

- Learn the magical language of the mages, and figure out a way to the outer world to complete the quest.

- 12 suspects and two possible endings depending on your conclusion: Who killed Dinyon?

188298.name: Fat Goblin Travel Guide to Epiphany's Wayside Inn
188298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Epiphany’s Wayside Inn! A seemingly innocent tavern of misfortune and mischief that preys upon the occasional traveler. Nearly always found amidst a deluge of poor weather or nestled along paths where roads are long and adventurers are desperately weary, this restless piece of architecture is the perfect mini-adventure to break the monotony of long treks.

Our Fat Goblin Travel Guide is designed for adventurer’s level 7-10 and details everything you need to drop this wandering nuisance into your ongoing campaign for a side trek or even an ongoing adventure!

Use it as a side trek in a larger adventure.
Tie it into a larger location in your campaign world.
Characters missed a specific item that they really need, it now rests in the Wayside Inn.
Introduce new NPCs, creatures, and hazards to your players.

188299.name: Triceratops
188299.description:
From publisher blurb:

"This time, it’s YOUSE gettin' extincted!"

Boerio “Barry” Oberto was just another hired thug working for the Cartels, until he was selected to be a test subject in the Ramses Corporation's efforts to create augmented superbeings. Becoming the mighty Triceratops, the Cartels sent Barry to deal with the annoying hero Recluse. Barry isn’t as dumb as people think, and his augmented muscles and suit of triceratops allow him to go toe-to-toe with some of the most powerful heroes on Earth.

188300.name: Knightstar
188300.description:
From publisher blurb:

Undaunted Champion of the Earth!

Knightstar is an ex-marine, ex-security expert, and ex-CASTLE agent who uses alien powers accidentally gained from the Khor Empire to protect the common people of Earth from all threats, be they the Meta Nation, Faez spies, or cosmic threats.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

188301.description:
Update: Toast! was not funded on Kickstarter, but the design was taken up by Horrible Games and developed into Raise Your Goblets.

Toast! is themed around ruthless medieval nobles trying to poison each other during the toasts at a royal function. The King has decreed a bizarre etiquette to be followed, in an attempt to discourage this behaviour. However, instead it has just turned the practice into an art and a sport, with each (surviving) noble having developed a particular expertise.

In a round of play, goblets are arranged in a circle in the middle of the table, one in front of each player, such that players can’t see their contents. Players take turns to secretly place wine, poison or antidote tokens into the goblets, switching the goblets around, or using their characters special abilities. Each player has a target, and their aim is to ensure that, when the round is ended by someone calling for the Toast and the players all ‘drink’, their target’s goblet is poisoned and theirs is safe!

The game supports 2-12 players. The main rules are for 4-6 players, there are special rules to extend up to 12 players (where pairs of players play as a noble and their wine-taster), and there is a separate game mode for 2-3 players (a sort of Russian Roulette with goblets).
188301.name: Toast!

188302.name: The Star's Refuge
188302.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Star’s Refuge is an adventure for expert characters, and will be best appreciated by players who love roleplaying and tough moral dilemmas. Whether on behalf of the people of the nearby villages or for reasons of their own, the characters seek the entrance to a fabled extradimensional refuge. Once they find it, they must gain entry and decide whether to pay the dark price required by the master of the refuge to enjoy the safety it promises.

188303.name: Five Spears
188303.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some great magic items for your Pathfinder game; well Avalon Games is here to help. Each issue of the Avalon's Mystic Treasures series will focus on five new magical items for any Pathfinder games. Each item comes with a full description, powers and cost, as well as history and adventure hooks. All you need to do is drop them into your game and watch your players squeal with delight.

Each issue will showcase news items and new treasures, so get each and every issue and add to your magical collection.

188304.description: Although Arcade and the Arachnoids expansion are high-end, laser-cut acrylic products, the expansion comes with space-sized card overlays to represent the webs the arachnoids can deploy. These Spiderwebs are clear, laser-cut acrylic, intended to mimic the look of a polymer spiderweb.
188304.name: Arcade: Reinforcements – Acrylic Tiles: Spiderwebs

188305.description: Although Arcade is a top-shelf, laser-cut acrylic product, it comes with space-sized card overlays to represent destroyed floor. These Destroyed Floor Tokens are clear, laser-cut acrylic, and their depth and the strange reflective properties of acrylic are designed to provide the illusion of actual holes in the floor.
188305.name: Arcade: Reinforcements – Acrylic Tiles: Destroyed Floor Tokens

188306.description: Although Arcade is a top-shelf, laser-cut acrylic product, it comes with space-sized card overlays to represent energy pools. These Energy Pool Tiles are laser-cut acrylic, intended to provide a classier look to a game in progress.
188306.name: Arcade: Reinforcements – Acrylic Tiles: Energy Pool Tile

188307.name: Outbreak: Undead Starter Kit
188307.description:
User summary:
Starter kit for the 2nd edition of Outbreak: Undead.

Included in the box:

160 page pocket edition rulebook
8 dice (two black d10 and eight color-coded d6)
80 reference cards
24 blank character sheets

188308.name: TUGS: The Universal Game System
188308.description:
User summary:

The TUGS: The Universal Game System rules were published as free online HTML and also as a downloadable ZIP archive containing six ASCII text files. Although the system was presented as a generic, universal system it was implemented in the science fiction genre only (planned fantasy expansions were never completed). The system primarily is a conglomeration of discreet rules components from several commercial systems which are credited in the introductory materials. Most of the game's innovations are found in the "Hardcore" combat rules.

188310.description:
A new array of adventures awaits the brave heroes of Mistfall. Mistfall - Encounter Pack 1 brings 18 new encounter cards to increase the replay value of Mistfall. They can be added to the base game without restrictions.

This Pack is already included in the Kickstarter Edition of Mistfall, and contains 18 Encounter cards (numbered 406-423).
188310.name: Mistfall: Encounter Pack 1

188311.description:
New enemies rise from the dark mists, threatening an already perilous world with their fierce axes and powerful magic. Mistfall - Enemy Pack 1 brings 18 new enemy cards to increase the replay value of Mistfall. They can be added to the base game without restrictions.

This Pack is already included in the Kickstarter Edition of Mistfall, and contains the following cards:

Green Enemies:
Fellstalker x3
Ice Reaver x3

Blue Enemies:
Ravenous Draugr x3
Undead Loremaster x3

Red Enemies:
Blackwood Ambusher x3
Twisted Lasher x3
188311.name: Mistfall: Enemy Pack 1

188312.name: Emotional IQ
188312.description:
How much of what you say is actually made up of your words?

Emotional IQ is a hilarious new party game for 2 players on up to party size groups. It’s easy to learn and easy to play. There are 2 types of cards: the Emotion Cards, and the Sentence Cards. You’ll choose 1 card from each stack and then deliver the sentence aloud for everyone to hear.

How do you say, “Great news everyone, I got engaged today” in your best sad voice? ...or... "That guy just sneezed all over you" in a voice full of Happiness?

Other players will have to guess which Emotion you are using. Here’s the catch – no one except you knows which Emotion card you drew, the Sentence and Emotion rarely match, and you only get 1 shot at your delivery.

It's a science experiment of your brain vs your mouth. Emotional IQ is designed by Bryan Sloan and illustrated by Roman Shipunov.

188313.description:
For the heroes who have already mastered their skills and have successfully battles and defeated the first four villains from the mists, two new quests await. Defeat Sycra, the Black Crusader and Karnas, the Betrayer to become the most praised hero of Mistfall.

Mistfall - Quest & Nightmare Time Cards features two new special enemy cards with their quests and setup cards as well as 13 new time cards for nightmarish difficulty.

This Pack is already included in the Kickstarter Edition of Mistfall, and contains the following cards:

13 Nightmare Time cards (numbered 426-438), replacing the included Time deck.

2 Quest Info cards (numbered 439 & 440).
2 Special Encounter cards (numbered 424 & 425).
2 Special Enemy cards (Sycra the Black Crusader & Karnas the Betrayer).
188313.name: Mistfall: Quest & Nightmare Time Cards

188314.description:
1916, Europe: The Great War has ravaged the land. Only one fertile ground remains and it is strongly disputed...by moles?

In Topoum, you control an army of moles that are fighting for control of a piece of fertile land in the middle of the Great War. The moles are well known for their blindness and, for this reason, you'll earn badges (points) if you can form uninterrupted lines of sight between your soldiers.

Topoum features several different types of cards of four categories: combat, movement, expansion and special. Each game is different because you build the playing deck with seven types of cards (+110.000 combinations!).

Each player has a private hand with two cards and there is a public row of five cards available for all the players on the board. This is the structure of the turn:


Choose between "Enter the Battle with a Mole" (playing one card is mandatory) or "Move Moles in the Battlefield" (playing a card is optional for each mole).
Score the lines of sight between your moles.
Refill the cards in your hand and the public row.


When the "Peace" card (hidden at the bottom part of the deck) is drawn, the game ends. The players now score extra badges for majorities and sets of the categories of the cards they used during the battle.
188314.name: Topoum

188315.name: Ukiyo Zoshi
188315.description:
User summary:

Ukiyo Zoshi was published as HTML in an unfinished state. The setting is partially and unevenly developed. The basic premise suggests several "factions" that vie for power and influence. The geographic setting consists of several "sectors" that connect to each other along defined pathways, all meeting at a central sector.

The action resolution system is referred to as the ISOMER System. It is presented as a standalone resolution mechanism using cards. Players flip a card and add their skill to the value, comparing this result against the game master's card flip added to a difficulty factor. In general, the card values swamp the modifiers making resolution mostly random. The rules favor narrative resolution whenever possible.

188316.name: Sig: the City Between
188316.description:
From the Kickstarter page:

There is only one true city; a place of multiversal trade, cultural exchange, and mixed blood. A place where monsters come to scheme and gods come to die.

Sig: The City Between is the nexus of the multiverse. It's a city connected to everywhere, a refuge for the oppressed and a prize for tyrants. It's a place where culture is at the forefront, with diverse faiths and tongues struggling for space in the crowded metropolis. It's a city of families, both whole and broken.

Sig is also a launching point, allowing fools and heroes to venture into the eternal planes of existence. Each plane is made of concepts, of elements, or of ideals that resonate through the entire 'verse. The planes impose their own Beliefs on Sig, and on the infinite primal worlds beyond.

188317.name: Investigator
188317.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – features feats for the investigator.

The Investigator is a combination of alchemist and rogue. They have a curiosity about the world around them and can use their knowledge as a weapon. They can be cunning advisors or explorers of mysteries. Having an investigator on your side is preferable to having one on your tail.

The feats you'll find inside this volume :

Experienced Mentor - Level bassed effects are treated as if you are one level higher.
Improved Recollection - You gain a bonus to all knowledge checks.
Improved Resistance - You can re-roll FORT of poison checks, once a day.
Improved Strike - Studying a target now grants an increased chance to hit.
Keen Eye - Your great eyesight makes perception checks and disarming easier.
Poison Knowledge - You gain a bonus to DC rolls related to crafting or neutralising poisons.
Talented - You can re-roll any dice roll related to Investigator talents.

188318.name: Elemental Domains of Metal and Wood
188318.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Elemental Domains of Fire, Water, Air, and Earth are represented by the core cleric Domains. However, the alternate elements of Metal and Wood as suggested by the Arcane elemental schools seemed to be lacking. These domains are introduced within this Player Paraphernalia along with two sub-domains for each focusing on both the natural and manufactured properties of each.

188319.name: El Conquistador
188319.description:
From publisher blurb:

An immortal bent on world domination... El Conquistador!

A Power Level 13 Rogue, El Conquistador has spent centuries seizing power! El Conquistador is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

El Conquistador's file is designated "Black" to represent the unknown origins of his abilities. He is armed with an indomitable will and artifacts of both mystical and technological origins. He is a world-class villain with world-class ambitions. Nothing short of the utter conquest of Earth will satisfy his thirst for power! This megamaniacal outlook makes him a perfect nemesis for heroes or teams who operate on a global scale, while his immortal background can easily connect to heroes with similar backgrounds. If your hero has walked the Earth for long enough, it is very likely they have crossed paths (and possibly swords) with El Conquistador in the past!

188320.name: Magic Helms of Porphyra
188320.description:
From publisher blurb:

Purple Duck Storerooms are short pdfs of experimental material. This volume includes:

11 new magical helms such as the armet of the serenity guard, codionic cone, and sorceress's headdress and many more.
2 cursed helms

188321.name: Jonathan Clarke's Empire
188321.description:
User summary:

The Empire rules are divided into two major sections: Setting (about 80 pages) and Mechanics (about 22 pages). The mechanics are somewhat typical of science fiction role-playing games but are definitively not presented for inexperienced gamers.

The setting is well-developed if somewhat roughly presented. It presents a vast human hegemony with centralized power staving off continual encroachment by about a dozen alien societies. The Empire itself is run by an established aristocracy of several great houses; inter-house conflict is continuous and expected. Other power centers include a partially-organized underground and several mega-corporations.

188322.name: MOP: Operation Cleanup
188322.description:
User Summary

Play as a tin man cleaning the streets.

188323.name: Chibi-Robo! Zip Lash
188323.description:
"Chibi-Robo! Zip Lash, known in Japan as Nagenawa Akushon! Guruguru! Chibi-Robo! (なげなわアクション！ぐるぐる！ちびロボ！) is a Nintendo 3DS game released in Japan and North America in October 2015, and in Europe and Australia in November 2015. A Chibi-Robo amiibo was also produced to interact with the game."

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chibi-Robo%21_%28series%29%23Chibi-Robo.21_Zip_Lash Chibi-Robo! (series)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188324.name: Non-Combat Magical Items Deck
188324.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is based on ongoing series of Non-Combat Magical Items from the Master Of Dungeons blog. Players love to receive magic items, and it's a great way to reward players for beating a dungeon, defeating a foe, or saving a village. However, too many magical +2 Lance of Goblin Explosion's can leave a party overpowered. This is especially true now in the world of Fifth Edition "Bounded Accuracy". There are 32 cards in the deck.

Some DMs have introduced something called "Mundane Magical Items" to their tables. These items aren't as strong as some of the glimmering, vibrating swords of the past, but they are still usually aimed towards a strong combat utility.

I've decided to take things a different direction at my table. In a magical world filled with dragons, genies, and portals to another dimension, I believe that there would be items that don't feel most at home on the battlefield. These items need not be only trivial magical implements like self-writing quills, or mirrors to help a dwarf with his self-esteem, they can rival the power of their magical sword and bow brethren.

As an added disclaimer, I don't refer to these items as "Non-Combat Magical Items" in front of my players. The title isn't so much a rule as it is a design philosophy.

These cards can be given to your players when they find an item, and can also be shuffled to add randomness to your loot.

Just because these aren't weapons or armour doesn't mean they aren't powerful, there are exceptionally strong items in here, like a sacrificial dagger that allows a user to absorb the powers of a dead god, or an amulet that prevents aging.

188325.description:
A squad-level, tactical game, ’65 recounts the early battles of the Vietnam War, from Ia Drang to Operation Starlight, and most everything between. The large and beautiful counters (1" to 1.375" square) represent squads, Leaders, Heroes, Snipers, M-48 and Pt-76 tanks, and more.

As these units’ commander you will move and fight over three geomorphic game boards as you try to best your opponent in one of eight, nail-biting historical scenarios. The game is card-driven, using a system similar to Flying Pig’s Night of Man, which adds a sense of delicious uncertainty to the play. “Can I advance my sappers or does the enemy have a fire card he's just waiting to play?" Furthermore, the cards simplify the game, containing much of the data needed to play. You won’t spend the afternoon with your head in a rule book when you play ’65. This is a game created by gamers for gamers to play.
188325.name: '65: Squad-Level Combat in the Jungles of Vietnam

188326.name: Fat Goblin Gazette (Issue 3 - Oct 2015)
188326.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fat Goblin Gazette is our new monthly newsletter covering all the amazing products we are working on, as well as giving you some free content, and showing off some books you might have missed. We will show off some of our website content, might do a contest, maybe even interviews. All the Fat Goblin Games freelancers are working hard developing new content for your grubby gamer hands, and this is where we will show off everything involved with that.

Not only will you see exciting things you might have missed, but you will also at times be privy to upcoming attractions and more importantly get an inside look at how we work.

Come experience each monthly installment and let us know what you want to see from us in the future!

188327.name: Stras
188327.description:
Wooden game that play with cards and dice. The goal is to get rid of all your card before the others players by moving your 4 pawns according to the 2 dice you will play.

You move your pawn on a wooden board that look like a spider web and where you can go in any direction and where you can only play one dice at a time. Your goal is to move your pawn to go reach the square that matches your cards in your hand.

When you reach the square of one of your card you can remove this card from your hand :)

188328.name: Starbound
188328.description:
User summary:

Starbound is a substantive supplement for the Valence 592 (Valence 1st Edition) game. It includes optional rules for traveling, living, and fighting in space, but primarily consists of background information to use in establishing the setting.

Starbound could be used with the Valence 2nd Edition rules with some (minimal) revision. The document was published as HTML and as a compiled PDF prior to the commercial release of the rules.

From the introduction:

1. Space is big.
2. Space is empty.
3. You have mass.
4. That way is up.

188329.name: Valence 592 (Player's Book)
188329.description:
User summary:

Valence 592 is the 1st Edition of the Valence game, published as free HTML and a compiled PDF available for download. In addition, the game manual was available as a series of PDFs for each major chapter. A (very) limited number of the compiled PDF version were printed, apparently for development circulation only. The 2nd Edition of the game, entitled only Valence, was commercially released.

From the introduction:

The history of the empires which have ruled the universe is long and bloody, analogous, some say, to the history of the human home world, Earth. There have been wars seemingly without beginning or end, ones without purpose or reason, and characteristic influences on the times as a result. Through singular battles and extensive wars the Universe was wrought from its primordial self to the present-day universe, in the Galactic Year 592.

188330.name: Doorways:   Holy Mountains of Flesh
188330.description:
User Summary

The plot of this game centers around the Torres family that controls a small Argentinian village. The game has rich graphics and detail as well as a mythos surrounding the Angel of the Flesh. This can be considered the fourth chapter of the Doorways series.

188331.name: Valence 592 (GM's Book)
188331.description:
User summary:

Valence 592 is the 1st Edition of the Valence game, published as free HTML and a compiled PDF available for download. In addition, the game manual was available as a series of PDFs for each major chapter. The GM's Book primarily is concerned with the setting and timeline of the Valence universe - information that, it is assumed, the players will discover through the course of the game.

From the master timeline:

This is the "official" way things happened in the universe of Valence 592. As you get into the last part of the timeline - the "future continuity" section - events might get in the way of your own campaign. Remember: don't enslave yourself to this timeline! Run your game however you want. This is just the "official" way things turn out. If your game would run better with things happening at different times (or not at all), so be it.

188332.name: The Lattice
188332.description:
The Computer Supplement for Valence 592

From the introduction:

In the early days of the Empire, computers were an important and ubiquitous part of human life. The older species had always used computers, but not to the pervasive extent that humanity did. In the long run, this turned out to be an instinct that served the older species well. For humanity, however, cybernetic interfaces and powerful microscopic computers gave them an edge that many were reluctant to surrender.

188333.name: Console: Handheld
188333.description:
User summary:

This perfectly-named fast-play option for the Console game is presented as a two-page print-and-play product. The pages are intended to be cut down into a handheld size booklet of nine pages, including a character sheet. The light-weight rules best emulate simpler games, such as those found on handhelds.

188334.name: 999 Games trakteert!
188334.description:
999 Games made this 25th anniversary gift pack in 2015. When purchasing any game by 999 Games, you would receive this as a gift.

It contains the following items:
- a mini-expansion for Catan (Catan: 999 Games 25 jaar Expansion)
- a try-out game of Carcassonne
- a mini game of SET
- a promo game of Ghost Blitz
- a try-out game of Absacker
- a (cardboard) try-out game of Qwirkle
- a 54 piece puzzle
- cash-back coupon book for all of the above

The box has the text "999 Games trakteert!" on it, which mean "999 Games treats!", as in a birthday treat.

188335.name: Baba Yaga: Queen of the Wicked Fens
188335.description:
From publisher blurb:

The witch is back! Baba Yaga, of Slavic legend, is here for 4E D&D! The child-eating, hex-tossing, pestle-wielding Queen of the Fens is here. Three complete and different stat blocks let you drop Baba Yaga into your campaign world at any tier. Baba Yaga: Queen of the Wicked Fens is the most complete guide to the 4E version of the world's most-feared hag. This guide contains: skill challenges, Baba Yaga's undead rider minions, her famous chicken-legged hut, her flying mortar and her hideous dziad allies.

188336.name: Incredible Insects Volume 1
188336.description:
From publisher blurb:

You can never have too many unusual and fun 4e D&D monsters. This pdf details 8 completely new monstrous insects from the grotesque, exploding honeypot ant (based on a real-world species) to centipedes who prefer to attack you in your dreams to swarms of blood-sucking mosquitos. There's also two versions of tick to 'tick off' your players and a goldbug that is deadly, valuable, and beautiful. Each monster is for the heroic tier and features the most up to date stat block, color illustrations and lore.

188337.name: WCP's Monstrous Garage Volume 1
188337.description:
From publisher blurb:

WCP's Monstrous Garage is finally available! Grab this book and be ready to jump into the garage. Hack off a claw, add some teeth, modify an aura and make literally dozens of possible creature creations all from the same stat block.

One stat block now equals nearly limitless options. WCP's Monstrous Garage Vol.1 contains six creatures from level 3 to level 13 from flying fungus to a tar-coated drake.

This book also includes frequently asked questions and a behind-the-scenes section of design notes to help you use the monstrous garage techniques on your own creations or other published foes.

Each creature is fully illustrated by top industry talents and the cover was exclusively created for this project by Sweden's Daniel Olsen.

188338.name: Robots Among Us
188338.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the colonization starship Warden entered a radiation cloud, every aspect of the ship was corrupted or drastically transformed. The biological mutations have been discussed at length. But the impact on the thousands of robots onboard has never been fully explored!

The starship Warden carried robots stored away to help humankind settle a new world, huge factories intended to manufacture still more useful robots, and automated terraforming machines ready to start work. When the ship passed through the radiation cloud, most of these electronic intelligences went insane!

In Robots Among Us, Metamorphosis Alpha creator James M. Ward provides 17 encounters built around the simple concept of “robots gone awry.” Ranging from a corrupted nanny unit to an angry self-aware war-tank, these encounters will give your players hours of new excitement!

188339.description:
Kickstarter exclusives for Arcadia Quest: Inferno, Hell of a box and Poison Dragon.

Hell of a box:

Kickstarter Exclusive Dice Bag

Demon Captains (2) Monster Cards and Figures
Kragor Monster Cards and Figure
Hellen Monster Card and Figure

Lucas Hero Card and Figure
Annika Hero Card and Figure
Lord Tyron Hero Card and Figure
Tigris Hero Card and Figure
Annabelle Hero Card and Figure
Tao Hero Card and Figure
Dris Hero Card and Figure
Gabriel Hero Card and Figure
Britney 'As Hero' Hero Card and Figure
Thornwood Hero Card and Figure
Johnny Hero Card and Figure
Sarya Hero Card and Figure
Kragor 'As Hero' Cards and Figure
Julie Hero Card and Figure
Mercury as Hero Card and Figure
Tyrek Card and Figure
Tyndall Card and Figure
Master Pim Hero Card and Figure
Vexia as Hero Card and Figure
Raven Hero Card and Figure
Hellen Hero Card and Figure
Sir Bryce Hero Card and Figure
Magu Hero Card and Figure
Papa Ruk Hero Card and Figure
Wanda Hero Card and Figure
Rivet Hero Card and Figure

The following figures are "pets" that can be used with the Pets expansion, but they are playable by themselves by simply assigning one to each guild.

Nixon Pet Card and Figure
Bones Pet Card and Figure
Gadget Pet Card and Figure
Biru Pet Card and Figure
Scrag Pet Card and Figure
Owlbunny Pet Card and Figure

Additionally, the Poison Dragon Expansion comes packaged separately in its own box, but is also a Kickstarter exclusive and comes along side the "Hell of a Box".

This includes an Oversized miniature, cards, tokens and map tile, along with an endgame scenario similar to the other Dragon expansions.

The Poison Dragon is an expansion for both Arcadia Quest, Arcadia Quest inferno, and can be played in conjunction with the Frost, Fire and Chaos Dragon expansions.

The game comes with a large Dragon Mini, new loot cards, new tiles and the new type of cards, "Dragonstone cards".

After finishing a campaign, the players will get a new load out of Level 6 Upgrade cards, with a budget that is based on the amount of medals each guild completed during the campaign.

This last part of the fight doesn’t have PvP Quest Cards and all players have to kill the Dragon before he wrecks too much of the city! This is a fully cooperative fight, in which the players win as a group if they manage to kill the Dragon and they lose if too many parts of the city have been destroyed, or if the Dragon kills Heroes so much that they can’t find the resolve to continue the fight. In this ultimate showdown, the Dragon is controlled by a special set of Dragon Turn cards that will trigger special attacks and movements from the Poison Dragon. Players will need to make tough choices in the face of the Dragon's actions, deciding as a group where to focus their efforts (and who to sacrifice).

Components

1 dragon figure
1 double-sided tile
24 level 6 upgrade cards
2 relic cards
14 dragonstone cards
24 dragon turn cards
20 poison tokens
2 dragon monster cards
1 rulebook/campaign booklet
1 dragon power card




The Poison Dragon turns the streets of Arcadia into a hazy gauntlet of deadly fumes, weakening heroes as he snuffs all life in the city. This expansion will bring an entire new epic showdown against this poisonous wyrm, featuring cooperative play between players through two scenarios where you have to ground the dragon, and prevent it from poisoning the entire city!
188339.name: Arcadia Quest: Inferno – Kickstarter Exclusives

188340.name: Tentacled Terrors
188340.description:
From publisher blurb:

[WCP's Monstrous Garage] is coming! Don't know what that is? Not a problem. Just pick up this free preview which gives the basics of making 4E monsters with easy variants! Then keep an eye on Escape Velocity Gaming and be ready to grab your wrench and head into the garage to make and modify some monsters!

rpgitemversion.312526: Expanded Options #01: Ritual Magic for 5th Edition PDF

188341.name: Ritual Magic for 5th Edition
188341.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ritual magic is interesting and accessible even to non-spellcasters, but as a concept, it is currently underdeveloped. There are too few ritual spells, and many opportunities not only to provide you with more spellcasting utility, but also to weave magic into your story in a way that is holistic and does not imbalance your campaign. This product contains a handful of new rituals, as well as guidelines for using rituals, rewarding players, and providing a deeper subtext for magic within your campaign setting. It also includes rules for casting ritual magic without the requisite ability at the cost of potential consequences and risks, as well as a new occult tool set!

188342.name: MountTen

22609.name: テンデイズゲームズ (Ten Days Games)

188342.description:
In MountTen (テンガロン), players want to rid themselves of cards in hand first in order to win the round. The deck consists of green cards numbered 1-40 and red cards numbered 10-30. Players start with ten cards in hand with 2-3 players and eight cards with 4-6 players. Set the deck nearby with the top card revealed.

The start player plays any card to the center of the table. The next player must play a card at most ten lower or higher than this card, e.g., playing 14-34 if the 24 was lead. If the second-played card is lower (higher), then all subsequent cards must be lower (higher) — but also always within ten of the most recently played card. If a player cannot or doesn't want to play, they pass and draw the top card of the deck, then reveal the new top card. If all players pass in turn, then whoever played the most recent card clears the table and leads a new card.

Two exceptions:

1. If the next player in turn can play a green card exactly ten lower or higher than the topmost card on the pile (no matter the direction of play), that player can call "Mount Ten!", play the card, then clear the table and lead a new card.

2. If any player can play a red card exactly ten lower or higher than the topmost card on the pile (no matter the direction of play), that player can call "Mount Ten!", play the card, then clear the table and lead a new card.

When one player has no cards in hand, the round ends. Each player with cards in hand scores -1 for each green card and -2 for each red card; the player who went out scores positive points equal to all the negative points scored that round. Complete as many rounds as the number of players, with the start player rotating each round. Whoever then has the highest score wins!

188343.description:
In Brides and Bribes, a strategy game played over six rounds, each player takes the role of a powerful family of Genova. Carefully employing your family members, each of whom has a unique ability, is the key to your success.

Each round, you plan send your family members to the Genovese boroughs to hire new employees, get new workers, and convince the local lord that your family is worth a marriage with his beautiful daughter. If you want to succeed, you have to send the right person in the right place.

Hire the most skilled people, intermarry with the most powerful families, poison your enemies, and increase your commercial empire!
188343.name: Brides & Bribes

188345.name: Ysgarth Advanced Roleplaying
188345.description:
Sixth Edition Basic Rules
XXVII Special Advance Edition

From the publisher:

[Ysgarth presents] classic roleplaying game rules, complete and detailed magic system, combat mechanics and alternative rules. Also includes substantial world background information.

First published in 1979, Ysgarth was the first classless fantasy roleplaying system, and the first system to offer a universal skill system, racial advantages, and a variety of other innovations later adapted by other games.

188346.name: Ysgarth Bestiary
188346.description:
From the introduction:

A guide to creatures from the world of Ysgarth. Four dozen creatures described and illustrated, plus a complete short adventure and more.

188347.name: Karty Dżentelmenów
188347.description: Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty Dżentelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). It's a polish spin-off CAH and the cards are 2 language (Polish and English).

188349.description:
Vastaryous’ Lair is a complete Sword & Sorcery expansion, including everything you need to play 4 epic Quests. Fight your way through the fierce Orc Tribes of Black Queen Island, overwhelm the Drakonic guards protecting the lair of the great wyrm, and prepare to fight the dragon in the fiery depths of its abode…

New Epic powers, armors, and items will help the Heroes rise to the peak of their power, reclaiming their ancient greatness. New mechanics have been developed for this expansion, to resolve the Epic fighting against Vastaryous - an opponent even more powerful than a “mere” Master Enemy. Each head is an intelligent being in itself, with different attacks and powers, posing a unique threat to the Heroes!

Vastaryous' Lair can be played as a side quest to Act II. Last but not least, Gremlins are playtesting a specific “Raid” mode, where up to TEN Heroes can fight against the terrible power of Vastaryous.
188349.name: Sword & Sorcery: Vastaryous' Lair

188350.name: Vis Imperia Victoriana
188350.description:
From the introduction:

The 19th Century was the grand time of Empire. New lands could be annexed by working class soldiers ever eager to find a King’s ransom in loot. The sons of the middle-class could hope for a better life in Colonial service and the younger sons of ancient families could earn themselves a name and perhaps even lands of their own. These quests would take them across the worlds, exploring jungles and wastelands unknown to "civilised Man". Of course the people living in these foreign, "unexplored" lands might rightly be said to have a different view of these adventurers, merchants and empire builders suddenly turning up on their doorsteps.

Nevertheless, before science-fiction the prime adventure genre was the fiction of empire, full of men who patronised the natives as a class but who treasured the friendship of individuals; dissolute Europeans or crafty viziers for villains; lost cities, bandit tribes and the sort of place where a stiff-upper lip and the ability to ride well were damn near all a gentleman needed and, unless a plucky adventuress or a native princess taking pity on an imprisoned chap, women were hardly seen.

188351.name: Void Trek 3007 A.D.
188351.description:
From the introduction:

Void Trek 3007 A.D., specifically, is a role playing game of space exploration, combat and discovery set in the 4th Millenium, in which the players are the crew of a faster-than-light spacecraft adventuring through the stars.

User summary:

Void Trek 3007 A.D. is a rule-light science-fiction role-playing game that especially is suitable for one-off or pick-up games. While the rules assume familiarity with typical game mechanics they are short enough to be utilized by newer players.

Note the game was released as two DOC files: a 10-page rules file and a 1-page ("Page 11") Omissions and Errata file. In addition, a third BMP file featured a full-color cover (see images).

188352.name: Void Trek 3008 A.D.
188352.description:
From the introduction:

These rules incorporate the original errata and clarifications from the famous errata sheet for the original VOID TREK 3007 A.D. as well as additional rules and corrections of typos.

Void Trek 3008 A.D., specifically, is a role playing game of space exploration, combat and discovery set in the 4th Millennium, in which the players are the crew of a faster-than-light spacecraft adventuring through the stars.

User summary:

Void Trek 3008 A.D. is a rules-light science-fiction role-playing game that especially is suitable for one-off or pick-up games. While the rules assume familiarity with typical game mechanics they are short enough to be utilized by newer players.

188353.name: VRAANZANNTH
188353.description:
User summary:

VRAANZANNTH is intended to be a generic, universal resolution mechanism for role-playing in any genre. The game uses an atypical dice method by rolling 1D12 and 2D6, with most results (except outright failure) being resolved with an action table.

Characters in the system have six Attributes: Strength, Reflex, Vitality, Personality, Mentality, and Vanity. Attributes typically range from +5 to -5. Vanity is also referred to as the "normalizer stat" and has three sub-values; it generally is used when something else don't seem to fit. Each Attribute covers a range of Skills, each Skill has a Points value. Attribute values and Skill Points are used as modifiers on action resolution dice rolls.

Version 2.0 presents a slightly more intelligible overview of the game rules as well as cleaned-up action tables and far fewer typographical errors from Version 1.0. Generally speaking, the two versions are interchangeable. Version 1.0 was titled VraanZannth.

188354.description:
Includes five Heavy Assault cards, one per player.

Value: 24
Main effect: Take 3VP from each opponent
Clash effect: Discard 2 cards.

Originally included as an extra in the boardgame Bottlecap Vikings.
188354.name: Eminent Domain: Battlecruisers – Heavy Assault

188355.description:
Includes two boomtown tiles:

Insurance Office: 1 point per building (Camp or Settlement) next to a hex that has been looted.
Hoosegow: 1 point per building of any color in the wanted area.

Included in Bottlecap Vikings.
188355.name: Gold West: Bandits Promo

188356.name: The Arkham Gazette (Issue 3 - Nov 2015)
188356.description:
From publisher's blurb:

"[H]e went back to Arkham, the terrible witch-haunted old town of his forefathers in New England, and had experiences... which made him seal forever certain pages in the diary of a wild-minded ancestor."

HP Lovecraft - "The Silver Key"

Welcome to the latest issue of The Arkham Gazette, the magazine all about Lovecraft Country for the Call of Cthulhu© role-playing game.

In this issue we dig deep into the charnel secrets of Lovecraftian witches and witchcraft, including:

New England's real witch trials
Witches in Lovecraft Country
Keeper's advice for making witch NPCs
The (Mythos) Gods of the Witches
The hidden link between ghouls and witches
Rat-things, Familiars, and the ghastly secret of their birth
The dark truth of Witches' Hollow
A bibliography of witch scenarios for Call of Cthulhu
The nightmarish witchcraft of our jumbo scenario "The Queen of Night"
and much more

120 pages of material for the Keeper to enrich their gaming experience in Lovecraft Country and beyond.

Issue comes with a PDF of high quality handouts prepared by Dean Engelhardt, including a bonus 9 page journal from a Miskatonic University student about the "Unvisited Island" in the Miskatonic (written by Chris Jarocha-Ernst) and a set of Call of Cthulhu 7th Ed. conversion notes (prepared by Dan Kramer).

188357.name: Wasteland Hero
188357.description:
From the introduction:

The post-holocaust genre has had good representation in science fiction literature. Most of the sources available were written, curiously enough, before World War II. The remainder seems to come from the cold war days of the mid-seventies into the early eighties. It has only met limited success as a role playing platform, all of the available games "out there" seem to support either World War III itself or else hundreds to thousands of years after the fall of civilization.

Wasteland HERO tends to be best played three to five generations after the final fall of civilization. The world is an ecological nightmare and very few life forms have survived intact. Of those species that survived, humans fared the best. They were ready for the devastation that they created. Their progeny, however, didn’t survive entirely intact. The integrity of the species was threatened spawning several new sub-species. As it turns out most of the "Neo-Earthers" were a product of the collapse of scientific ethics in the last days of man. The once familiar creatures of the earth were transformed into mighty beasts worthy of legend, and hostility quickly replaced serenity for the sake of survival in a barren world.

188358.name: Waste World Lite (HTML Version)
188358.description:
From the introduction:

Waste World Lite: A Fist Full of Credits, published by Manticore Productions Limited, is a complete role-playing adventure game. These HTML pages are an edited version of that book. The background and rules appear in the same form as the book, and these contain everything you need to play except dice. The difference between these HTML pages and the book is that most of the book's images have been left out to speed viewing, and only the first adventure of the book's three part mini-campaign is included here. This is self contained, however, so you won't find the action ending 'mid-sentence'.

188360.name: Ranger Firebase Alpha
188360.description:
From the introduction:

A world without hope. A war without mercy. That's the world we live in. The air is poisonous. The seas are dead. Mutants roam the poisoned wastes. Mechanized barbarians plunder the scattered settlements. Sentient death machines stalk the survivors. The ultimate power source, drakonium, is becoming rarer and rarer with each passing year. In the last of the megacities, five warrior civilizations prepare for doomsday.

Somebody has to hold it together. That's what we're for.

Welcome to the Rangers. Welcome to Firebase Alpha.

188361.name: Adventure Journal (Volume 1, Number 16)
188361.description:
This periodical stretches the term "magazine" to its limits and perhaps breaks it. Every issue is more like a complete Sourcebook than anything else.

This issue features:
- "Gathering Shadows"
- Corellian Translines
- A Servant of the Empire
- Hutt & Seek
- Credit Denied
- The Garos System
- lots of new equipment
- new rules

Special note: This issue was never officially released. That being said, there are copies of it, albeit very rare.

188362.name: Adventure Journal (Volume 1, Number 17)
188362.description:
This periodical stretches the term "magazine" to its limits and perhaps breaks it. Every issue is more like a complete Sourcebook than anything else.

This issue features:

- Jade Solitaire
- Special Ops: The Art of Infiltration
- Shifting Gears
- Love is a Warm Blaster

188363.name: Norfin Trolls: Magic Mountain Adventure Game
188363.description: Game is played on a large plastic floor mat. Comes with large plastic dice and four small troll dolls for playing pieces. Game board and play is similar to Candyland with bridges that can be used for shortcuts. Winner is the first to reach the castle.

188364.name: Global War 1936-1945
188364.description:
Global War-2nd Edition 1936-1945

Global War-2nd Edition is the ultimate game in its genre. This is a completely remastered version of Global 1939. The scope of the game has been greatly expanded. Here are some of the key points:

The Rules

There are a lot of rules in Global War -2nd edition but do not be intimidated! Many of them are optional and you are encouraged to select rules that suit the type of play you enjoy. New rules in this expansion include;


Multi-stage ship and facility production
Advanced research development system with 13 technologies.
Nation-specific victory objectives
New Lend-lease system where players can lend money or units.
Soviet Union as a third alliance
Spanish Civil War
Chinese Civil War
Advanced convoy raiding system with world-wide convoy routes and escorts
New units including airborne infantry, militia, cavalry, mountain infantry, marines, medium bombers, coastal submarines (and more)
Carpet Bombing
Combat Air Patrol
Diplomatic Pacts
Strategic Rail Movement
New facilities: Shipyards, coastal artillery, fortifications (and more)


AND MORE

New Map

The new map is completely redone with more territories and land features than ever. These include;


Mountains
Rivers
Baltic-White Sea Canal
Minor power colonies
New nations
Chinese Warlord Regions


AND MORE

Expansions

Global War-2nd Edition is already the most expanded game of its genre. Already released we have

• Fighting Railways
• U.S. & German Ordnance
• Amerika Companion
• United States Unit Set #3
• The Few the Proud, The Marines
• Alaskan Warriors
• Over 30 3D Printed Game Units
• And more coming!!!

188365.name: Passage
188365.description:
A fascinating two handed strategy game. To win, be the first person to build a winding line connecting your two designated sides and block your opponent from doing so.
A handicap system is also provided so that two players with uneven skills can still enjoy the game

Comes with another game - Blockade.

188366.name: Cult of the Wind
188366.description:
Cult of the Wind is a game about people who pretend to be airplanes.

"In an unknown time and place, a cult that worships the wreckage of ancient airplanes gathers to mimic the dogfights of old. With the peak of humanity far behind, their world is a mausoleum to a lush and verdant Art Deco past."

In Cult of the Wind, players compete and cooperate in ritualistic multi-player human dogfights, complete with imaginary weapons, pretend explosions, and airplane noises made with their mouths. Shower your friends in a hail of imaginary bullets and proclaim, "I got you! You have to lie down," to which they respond, "Nuh-uh, I have a shield." You argue about whether or not airplanes can have shields, meanwhile some other guy does a cannonball onto your head while whistling. It's great.

Source: The Game Website.

188367.name: Vault of the Faceless Giants
188367.description:
From publisher blurb:

This module includes several encounters that use mechanics and content from Old School Adventures Accessory PX1: Basic Psionics Handbook. Additionally, many of the encounters will be made more enjoyable by having a character of the mystic class in the party. If you do not plan to use the material from the Basic Psionics Handbook, some of the encounters may require modifications in order to facilitate playability.

188368.name: The 3 Rocketeers

rpgseries.26090: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System

188368.description:
From publisher blurb:

Journey through the Holy Roman Stellar Empire and the worlds of Britannica Solaria in this Fate World of Adventure by PK Sullivan! The Queen’s enemies may have disbanded the Rocketeers, but duty cannot be set aside so easily.

A deadly cabal of nobles and clergy threaten to usurp Her Majesty Queen Marie-Hélène’s throne and hand Gallia over to Pope Regulus IV, and the Rocketeers now work from the shadows to protect the queen from threats both foreign and domestic. Foreign spies and papal agents lurk in every shadow as the trap draws ever closer.

A laser-sharp blade and even sharper wits will serve you well as interstellar powers play the game of puppets and shadows. The fate of the crown is in your hands.

The Three Rocketeers requires Fate Core to play. This 40-page supplement includes:

Rules for no-skill Fate, where aspects provide roll bonuses without invocation
Categorized aspect creation to help players create their characters quickly and get the most out of their invocations
A simple system to build flashy customized swordplay stunts
Conspiracy creation guidelines that integrate aspects and approaches to help direct the story
Ready-made characters based on the characters of Alexandre Dumas
A sample adventure: Battle for the Gallian Throne




The Three Rocketeers: All for one and one for all!

188369.name: Zaza the Mystic
188369.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The spirits see all, and they see your guilt."

How do you rebel if you're a teenager who's been raised in a circus to be the Gypsy Queen of Fortunetellers and to bilk the rubes out of money? If you're Zaza Kamlo, you run away to the big city, date a police officer, and use your talents to catch criminals rather than being one.

Zaza the Mystic presents four illustated mysery stories by Jerry Siegel, the co-creator of Superman. It also contains d20 System feats and talent trees for playing characters who are cold readers (like Zaza) and profilers (like the heroes on Criminal Minds)--characters who use powers of observation to get ahead of the villians.

188370.name: Cult of the Colour out of Space
188370.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold! The Cult of the Colour out of Space!

What is the agenda of this alien worshipping cult? Why would any creature follow an entity that seems ambivalent to their existence while simultaneously draining them of their life force? What are the secrets of the Colour out of Space? How do you defeat such a creature?

Herein are the secrets of this sinister cult, along with a sample cell of followers, an occultist archetype, and new magic items including the cursed Mysterium Magnus; a rare tome full of foul secrets and vile magic.

188371.name: Curse of the Kobold Eye (Swords & Wizardry)
188371.description:
From publisher blurb:

An unusual curse from their last brush with danger befalls a party of adventurers! Haunted by the spectral image of a one-eyed kobold warrior, the heroes must race to unravel the mystery of the curse while avoiding death at the hands of their ghostly visitor. Can they stop the effects of the curse in time before it consumes them entirely? A harrowing journey awaits them!

WK2 Curse of the Kobold Eye is the second adventure in Cut to the Chase Games’ Fantasy Renaissance Module Adventure module trilogy, WRATH OF THE KOBOLDS. It is designed for a group of 4 to 6 characters levels 2 to 4. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

188372.name: Curse of the Kobold Eye (Pathfinder)
188372.description:
From publisher blurb:

An unusual curse from their last brush with danger befalls a party of adventurers! Haunted by the spectral image of a one-eyed kobold warrior, the heroes must race to unravel the mystery of the curse while avoiding death at the hands of their ghostly visitor. Can they stop the effects of the curse in time before it consumes them entirely? A harrowing journey awaits them!

WK2 Curse of the Kobold Eye is the second adventure in Cut to the Chase Games’ Fantasy Renaissance Module Adventure module trilogy, WRATH OF THE KOBOLDS. It is designed for a group of 4 to 6 characters levels 2 to 4. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

188373.name: Curse of the Kobold Eye (5E)
188373.description:
From publisher blurb:

An unusual curse from their last brush with danger befalls a party of adventurers! Haunted by the spectral image of a one-eyed kobold warrior, the heroes must race to unravel the mystery of the curse while avoiding death at the hands of their ghostly visitor. Can they stop the effects of the curse in time before it consumes them entirely? A harrowing journey awaits them!

WK2 Curse of the Kobold Eye is the second adventure in Cut to the Chase Games’ Fantasy Renaissance Module Adventure module trilogy, WRATH OF THE KOBOLDS. It is designed for a group of 4 to 6 characters levels 2 to 4. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

188374.name: Bad Blood
188374.description:
From publisher blurb:

How I Wonder Where You Are

Something strange is going on at the Dogsend Children’s Workhouse. Children are disappearing, and no one knows where they’re going... or at least, no one is talking.

Discover the secrets of the orphanage before another child gets taken, but be sure to watch your back, lest you be taken, too.

Bad Blood is a one shot adventure for the Through the Breach roleplaying game.

188375.name: Chaos Earth Resurrection
188375.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the shattered depths of Wisconsin, survivors are besieged by the dead come back to life. Zombies. But not just any type of zombie, zombies done Rifts-style. And unless the source of the zombie plague can be found and neutralized by NEMA defenders, North America may be overrun by the dead.
This was actually something Taylor White and I have been kicking around for years, even before we released the Dead Reign® RPG line. We think you’ll love it.

Something has animated the dead in Wisconsin. It is up to NEMA heroes to find the cause and stop it before it spreads beyond control.
Scrap Zombies of all types.
Snatcher Ghouls, Carrion Cleaners, Screaming Puppet Ghosts, Sour Maggot Parasites, and other monsters.
The Zombie Pox and other dangers.
Setting background, adventure and adventure idea table.

188376.name: Imperial Land Griffon
188376.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

The Imperial Land Griffon is essentially a wingless hippogriff, bred for use by grounded cavalry. Although there are some that have escaped to live and breed in the wild, most live in captivity to be trained to serve as war mounts or for scouting. Either is very dangerous and not to be underestimated simply because they cannot fly.

188377.name: Mo Mo Toretore

31026.name: キングダイズゲーム (KingDaiz Game)

188377.description:
User summary
In the game of モーモートレトレ (Mo Mo Toretore), you are an alien Primary Schoolchild. During a school outing to the planet Earth, your teacher told you to capture cows in the field.

The teacher specifies how many cards you must play, and you play that number of cards. If the cards' total face value equals a cow's number, you can capture the cow. (Your arithmetic skills are tested because you are a Primary Schoolchild).

If you are the only one who played your number, you get the whole points, otherwise points are divided among players who played that number.

With cute illustrations, this card game can be enjoyed by all, from children to adults. This game is especially good for those who frequently play with Primary Schoolchildren or new gamers. The first edition is published in Japanese but English rules are available online.

Publisher's summary
モーモートレトレは、宇宙人の小学生となってウシを捕まえるのが目的のゲーム。
先生の指示の枚数のカードを使って手札の数字とウシの数字をあわせよう。（簡単な足し算引き算が必要です）
自分だけが出した数字なら独り占め、他の人も出してたら分け合おう。

かわいらしい絵柄で、お子様から大人まで楽しんでいただけるカードゲームです。
特に小学生くらいのお子さんやゲーム初心者の方と遊ぶ機会が多い方にお勧めのワイワイと楽しめるゲームに仕上がりました。

188378.name: Waste World Lite (DOC Version)
188378.description:
From the introduction:

Waste World is a planer ravaged by ten millennia of total war, where five gigantic city-states are locked in a deadly struggle for control of the most precious substance in history: Drakonium, the ultimate energy source.

Everyone knows that without Drakonium their automated factories will cease to function. Their lights will go out. Their air will become unbreathable. Their people will starve. And everyone knows that Drakonium is running out.

188379.name: Waste World Character Generator
188379.description:
User summary:

Waste World Character Generator is an XLS spreadsheet that can be utilized to generate characters for the Waste World game fairly quickly. The workbook uses numerous formulas to automate most of the difficult math of character creation. The workbook has several sheets that allow user input that support a type of customization. The sheet does not support all possible game functions but is quite robust.

188380.name: DomiNations

videogamehonor.35670: 2016 D.I.C.E. Best Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

188380.description:
CONQUER THE PAST, RULE THE FUTURE
Domi Nations is an epic combat strategy game of advancement, exploration, and conquest from legendary game designer Brian Reynolds(Civilization II, Rise of Na- tions). Choose your Nation from among the greatest civilizations of the world, and lead it to ultimate victory throughout all of human history - from the Stone Age to the Space Age!

Build a capital city, train your army and dominate rival Alliances to become the most powerful ruler on the planet!
Source: game's website: http://www.dominations.com/

188381.name: World of Heroes & Tyrants: Introductory Edition
188381.description:
User Summary:

This document, published in online HTML and also downloadable PDF formats, provides a quick-start, or introductory, set of rules for the game. It allows routine play but does not provide complete information. An abbreviated bestiary is included.

188382.description:
This extension was on the back of the catalogue of the Haba Family Games.

Each player receives an extra chip at the beginning of the game. It can be used during the course of the game once in order to roll the dice again to replace an undesired dice result.
Then the extra chip is removed from the game. The player receives 5 Spookies if the extra chip isn’t used.
188382.name: Spookies extension 1: Dice Joker

188383.name: Kuro Tensei
188383.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mysterious island, Ryugu Island, has emerged from the depths of the Pacific Ocean off the coast of Japan. Accompanied with typhoons and a supernatural red storm, the island’s appearance has opened the gate of Yomi-No-Kuni and unleashed a wave of vile Oni and insane Yokai, creatures too long locked away in the grey lands of death.

In the aftermath of the red storm, normal men and women discover they are descended from ancient spirits. While some refuse their heritage, others accept their fate. From now on, they are no longer unarmed and alone in the face of the supernatural. Instead they are true heroes, armed with Ki swords, ritual incantations and destructive o-fuda. They are the new army of the Emperor, charged with closing the gates of Yomi once and for all.

This last volume in the Kuro saga contains all the rules needed to take the characters in your game into the Kuro Tensei setting, including new powers and new abilities. You will also find an overview of Japan, now plunged into a terrifying occult war, as well as formidable enemies and three complete scenarios.

188384.description:
This extension was on the back of the catalogue of family Games from Haba.

At the beginning of the game, the ghost is in the room next to “>= 9.” If a playing piece is on the same storey as the ghost, a dice is “stolen” from the player. This means they only
have a maximum of three die for this throw. After this throw, the player has to move the ghost one storey up or down.
188384.name: Spookies extension 2: Spooky Ghost

188386.name: Wheel of Time (7 Books)
188386.description:
User summary:

Character creation begins with a concept and then the selection of Traits. Instead of using pre-determined Traits, players select which Traits complement their character concept. Sample Traits (which function somewhat like Attributes) include: Agile, Witty, Lithe, and Astute. Traits need not be positive. Players then allocate ten build points to purchase Background, each selection yielding certain benefits. Backgrounds are divided by type, including: Social, Physical, or Skills. One Skill is Talent which comes in a variety of abilities. Perhaps the most powerful Background/Skill/Talent is Channeling which also is complex. Characters may also have Nationality and Childhood Skills. All characters then begin further development at age 14, and the player plots out a Career Path (this may not be completed, but will at least commence). The last step in character creation is outfitting.

Action resolution is divided into different types: Normal Test, Stress Test, or Opposed Test. In all of these, the player rolls 1D20 and one or more D6. The D6 roll "explodes" on a 6. The summed D6 total either adds to, or subtracts from, the D20 roll for a final result which is compared to an action table. Whether the D6 is a bonus or penalty is determined by the type of test and situational modifiers.

188387.name: Artefakt (Issue 16 - 2005)
188387.description:
This issue contains adventures of the following RPG systems:

- Mummy: The Resurrection (Hinter dem Wüstenschleier)
- Call of Cthulhu (Totentanz)

Furthermore:
